loans.name: Wilmor Gustavo

texts.es: Wilmor Gustavo mayor de edad soltero del domicilio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es propietario de un taller de vulcanización como también de reparación de triciclo, enrayado y enderezado de aros, este negocio actualmente se encuentra ubicado en una de las calles principales de uno de los municipios de Chinandega cerca de una de esas gasolineras, el desde muy temprano inicia su jornada de trabajo para ofrecer mejores servicios y que sus clientes queden satisfechos,  uno de sus sueños es ver crecer mas su negocio y el de mejorar sus vivienda, Wilmor esta solicitando financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo, en reparación de triciclo, y en la compra y venta de repuestos .-
texts.en:
Wilmor Gustavo is a single adult who lives in Chinandega, which is in the western part of the country.  He has a shop where he repairs tires as well as repairing tricycles and lacing and  straightening wheels.  This business is located on one of the main streets in one of the municipalities in Chinandega close to a gas station.  He starts his workday very early in order to offer better services and so that his customers will be satisfied.

One of his dreams is to see his business grow more and to improve his house.

Wilmor is requesting this loan to invest in working capital, for tricycle repair, and to buy and sell replacement parts.

loans.use: to buy and sell all types of bicycle replacement parts, among others.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, a 57-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

The recipient of 18 previous loans from NWTF, all repaid, Leonora has been running her store for 12 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 42 years old, has two school-aged children, both of whom she and her husband want to properly educate. They believe that education is the only treasure they can give to their children. Through the profit she makes in her retailing business, Lydia is able to provide her children school allowances, while her husband earns income as a family driver.

Because their oldest child is about to graduate next semester, Lydia and her husband are striving hard to earn more income. She is thereefore requesting a loan of Php 30,000 to buy more drinks and snack foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Thabu

texts.en:
Thabu  is a married woman, with four children. All of her children attend school, which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. 

Thabu has operated a kiosk retail business for the past two years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality and transportation as her major challenges. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, and beans for her kiosk. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, and beans for her kiosk.

loans.name: Salvador Augusto

texts.es: Salvador, con 55 años de edad es soltero y padre de un hijo de 12 años. Por la difícil situación económica en la que se encontraba debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo, él decidió capacitarse en medicina oriental realizando un curso intensivo personalizado. Gracias a esto, montó un consultorio donde ofrece atención en medicina oriental, realiza terapias y comercializa productos de salud y nutrición, además presta el servicio a domicilio; de esta forma ha logrado obtener los recursos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Salvador es un hombre emprendedor, juicioso, con proyección y ganas de salir adelante, por esta razón solicita el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de productos de salud y nutrición Amway  (vitaminas, complementos dietarios, malteadas y batidos dietéticos) con el fin de ofrecer una variedad de productos que mejore el bienestar físico y mental de sus clientes; así tendrá la oportunidad de vender más, aumentar sus ingresos y tener mayor rentabilidad, lo que le permitirá  avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su meta principal que es ampliar más su negocio y lograr que sea reconocido en todo el oriente antioqueño, de esta forma tendrá la capacidad de ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor educación y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
55-year old Salvador is single and the father of a 12-year old son. Because of his difficult financial situation due to lack of jobs, he decided to take personalized courses in oriental medicine. As a result he was able to start offering therapeutic services in oriental medicine and selling health and nutritional products from his office. As well Salvador travels to people's houses. He has managed to earn enough money in this way to support his household.

Salvador is an entrepreneurial, level-headed man who wants to make progress in life so he is seeking a loan to buy Amway health and nutrition products (vitamins, dietary supplements, malt drinks and shakes). He wishes to offer his customers products that will improve their physical and mental health. With the loan he will have the opportunity to sell more, increase his income, and have a more profitable business. Then he will get closer to his main goal of expanding his business and being known throughout the eastern Antioquia area. Salvador will then be able to provide his son with a better education and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: buy Amway health and nutrition products (vitamins, dietary supplements, malt drinks and shakes)

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio lives in Inroad, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur with his family. He is 20 years old and studies at Western Mindanao State University, where he is an electrical technology student. His parents grow and sell rice to earn a living.

Despite some obstacles, Elpedio is working very hard to realize his ambition of finishing his studies. Hopeful for an opportunity to work at any company related to his field of study, he is requesting this loan to help pay his tuition fees. He looks forward to the chance of earning a good living in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Norma has a pottery business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Norma has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Mohamedi, who is in his mid 40s, is married with four children. All of Mohamedi's children are enrolled to school. 

Since 2006, Mohamedi has been running a shop, selling motorcycle spare parts. He is doing fine with his business and with his family, as well. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be his tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. From the previous loans, all which he repaid successfully, he managed to purchase more business spare parts and to buy a business motorcycle. With his business profit, he paid school fees, household expenses, and he bought a plot of land where he built a house. 

Mohamedi will use this loan to buy the missing spare parts for his shop. Mohamedi dreams to expand his business with more branches.  

He will share this loan with his loan group, Juhudi Group, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the missing spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Naranjo Group

texts.es:
San Miguel Soyaltepec es una bella comunidad la cual se encuentra ubicada a la orilla de la presa Miguel Aleman y la principal actividad económica es la pesca y venta de mojarra, esta comunidad es visitada por la gente de los pueblos cercanos para pasar tardes familiares a la orilla de la presa disfrutando de una rica mojarra preparada al gusto. 

en esta comunidad existe un grupo llamado Naranjo el cual esta integrado por 7 personas cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con la intención de brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida Ofelia venta de ropa, Javier papeleria, Evelin venta de refrescos, Jose Luis venta de helados y raspados, Gilberta venta de ropa, Ismael venta de abarrotes, Marco venta de aguas y nieves. 

Don Javier es comerciante desde hace nueve años el tiene una papelería en el centro de esta comunidad, el platica que cuando inicio con esta actividad fue porque no había una papelería en la comunidad y era difícil cuando querían los estudiantes conseguir algún material escolar, ademas que pretendía ganar su propio dinero para brindar a su familia una vida de calidad y ayudarse con el pago de la escuela de sus hijos.

El esta muy contento ya que con el paso de los años su negocio ha progresado y aumentando sus ventas, el ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de gomaz, lapices, lapiceros, colores, hojas blancas, papel bond, libretas, cuadernos, sacapuntas, cartulinas para resurtir su negocio y estar preparado para el regreso a clases que es la temporada cuando mas vende.

A don javier lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que ha diario trata con personas y ha hecho buenas amistades, ademas de que enseña a sus hijos a trabajar porque por las tardes lo ayudan a atender el negocio.

el espera que en un futuro su negocio continué creciendo para dar a sus hijos las oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
San Miguel Soyaltepec is a beautiful community that is on the banks of the lake Miguel Aleman and the principal economic activity here is fishing. The community is visited by people from the surrounding towns who come here to spend time with their families. They take advantage of the beaches and  enjoy the delicious mojarra fish that is found here. 

In this community there is a group called Naranjo, made up of 7 people, each of whom has their own business that they use to try to give their families a better life; Ofelia sells clothes, Javier sells paper, Evelin sells soft drinks, Jose Luis sells ice cream and slushies, Gilberta sells clothes, Ismael sells groceries and Marco sells water and sorbets. 

Don Javier has been running his business for 9 years and he has his own paper supply store in the center of this community. He says that when he started his business, it was because there was nowhere to buy paper products in town and the students there had a hard time getting a hold of school materials. He also wanted to earn his own money so he could give his family a better life and to help pay for his children's schooling. 

He is very happy that over the years his business has grown and his sales have increased. He is asking for a credit in order to invest in purchasing more products like erasers, pencils, mechanical pencils, crayons, paper, glue, notebooks, exercise books, pencil sharpeners and poster board so he can restock his business and be ready for back to school season, which is when he sells the most product. 

The thing that don Javier likes the most about his business is that he gets to talk to people everyday and make friends with them, as well as being able to teach his children the importance of hard work because they help him in the afternoons in the store.

He hopes that in the future, his business will continue to grow and he will be able to give his children the opportunity to study for a professional career.

loans.use: purchase erasers, pencils, mechanical pencils, crayons, paper, glue, notebooks, exercise books, pencil sharpeners, and poster board.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Oscar y ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia. Gracias a su buen carácter ella, logró afrontar muchos problemas con optimismo. Aún cuenta con terrenos alquilados, eso hace que trabaje con más empeño, ya que tiene que pagar los alquilares anuales. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, maíz, alverja y habas, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación ya que de ello dependen sus ingresos económicos. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y ovejas, las cuales engorda para comercializarlos a buen precio. Asimismo tiene una vaca y un becerro, los cuales producen leche, que comercializa a 2 nuevos soles por litro de esa manera obtiene un ingreso adicional. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir una poyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. María, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
48-year old María is married to Oscar and they have six children although only four still live with them. Because of her fine character, María has managed to confront any problems with optimism. She has to work really hard on her rented land since she has to pay the rent each year.

María's main crops are potatoes, corn, peas and beans which she looks after carefully as she depends on them for income. As well she raises animals such as chickens and sheep. She fattens them and then sells them for a good price. María also has a cow and a calf and sells the milk for 2 soles a liter which gives her additional income. 

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for this financial assistance which allows her to get ahead. She promises to pay back the loan punctually. She plans to use the loan money to buy organic manure to spread on her crops.

loans.use: Buy organic manure

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es:
Keyla es una joven estudiante de Psicología Industrial, ella está solicitando un préstamo de estudio para poder cubrir sus gastos de matricula, libro y transporte. Esta es su historia: 

Mi nombre es Keyla, tengo 20 años y vivo en Santo Domingo Este. República Dominicana.  Soy soltera y no tengo hijos. Actualmente trabajo en un centro educativo como secretaria, vivo con mi madre y dos de mis hermanos, soy la menor.
Quiero estudiar Psicología Industrial porque me gusta y tengo perfil para ello, además quiero superarme como persona. Tengo metas trazadas, tales como hacerme profesional, obtener una mejor calidad de vida, mi casa propia, ayudar a mis padres a una vejez tranquila, que mis futuros hijos puedan tener una mejor vida que la que he tenido, entre otras. Lamentablemente no cuento con los recursos suficientes,  ya que donde laboro mi ingreso es son muy bajos y no es  suficiente para mis gastos.  No tengo  apoyo económico de mis padres por sus condiciones económicas, mi madre labora como niñera en una casa de familia y mi padre actualmente no labora. Necesito participar de este hermoso proyecto KIVA, ya que sin él me resultaría muy difícil estudiar, o tendría que esperar hasta conseguir una mejoría económica. Quiero empezar mis estudios cuanto antes, ya que tengo 3 años que terminé el bachiller y no he podido avanzar nada por falta de recursos.
texts.en:
Keyla is a young Industrial Psychology student. She is requesting an education loan to be able to cover the costs of her registration fees, books, and transportation.

My name is Keyla. I am 20 years old and I live in Santo Domingo Este in the Dominican Republic. I am single and I do not have children. Right now I work in an education center as a secretary. I live with my mother and two of my siblings; I'm the youngest.

I want to study Industrial Psychology because I like it and it's a good fit for me. I have goals outlined, like becoming a professional, securing a better quality of life, having my own home, helping my parents to have a peaceful old age, and making sure that my future children have a better quality of life than the one that I have had, among others. Unfortunately, I do not have sufficient resources. Where I work, the pay is really low and it's not enough for my expenses. I don't have any financial support from my parents due to their own financial situation. My mother works as a nanny for a family and my father isn't working right now. 

I need to participate in this amazing Kiva program because without it, it would be really hard for me to study or I would have to wait until I was in a better financial situation. I want to start studying as soon as possible because it has already been three years since I graduated from high school and I haven't been able to get started due to a lack of resources.

loans.use: to pay for registration fees, books, and transportation.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 45 years old, married and has two children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosario has a pottery business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy material needed for her pottery business.  Rosario has been in this business for six years. I

In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is from Vanadzor town. Her son currently serves in the army and her husband went abroad to find a job to financially support his family. 

For 18 years, Armine has been involved in a retail business. She purchases clothing from Yerevan and sells it in her town. Due to her hard work and kind attitude toward people, Armine over these years, is known among her customers as a good seller. She has gained many customers, who prefer to purchase clothing from her. 

To develop her business, several times, Armine has requested a loan from local financial institutions, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. 

Armine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Armine to purchase clothing in order to sell it locally. 

She dreams to have a stable income which will improve her family's living conditions and her husband will be able to come home.

loans.use: to pay for clothing supplies for selling to customers.

loans.name: Muhit A Shg Group

texts.en:
A mother of two kids, Kipjang is pictured with her hand raised. She is the featured borrower member for Muhit A Shg Group. The group comprises twelve tribal women members who are financially independent and generate income for their respective families. All the group members reside in a village on the northern part of Manipur state, which is also one of the northeastern states in India. 

Kipjang’s husband is a teacher in a private school, and his earning is insufficient to manage the family’s expenses. The income that her husband generates is mainly used for their kids’ education. The rest of the expenses are borne by Kipjang, who raises cattle and weaves to supplement the family income.

Kipjang is raising cattle at her home, and she has one female cow with a calf at present. The cow and the calf are usually reared at the nearby fields for fresh grass to eat. The milk produced is sold every day to the neighbours, as the milk quantity is enough to sell. The income generated is usually used for daily expenses, which is why there are times when they don’t have enough cash to purchase feed for the cattle. 

Besides raising cattle, Kipjang also weaves to make more income for the family. She usually purchases yarn and thread from the city market and weaves with them. Her woven finished products are women’s wrap-around skirts, men’s traditional shawls, and women's traditional shawls. The demands for woven products are high, as they are the main attire for the women in their tradition. Kipjang could not meet the demands of her customers. The unavailability of looms paralyzes her to produce more woven products, as she weaves with the traditional back-strap. She hardly manages three or four at the maximum in a month. 

She wants a loan from Kiva and WSDS to purchase nutritional feed for the cattle and more yarn for weaving purposes. The nutritional feed is necessary, as the cow is also used in place of a machine for ploughing purposes, and the milk production needs to be adequate in quantity. She also wanted to purchase various yarn for weaving purposes to weave better and expensive woven products. That way, she will generate a better means of income and repay the loan amount in time. 

She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the wonderful deeds and says she is delighted to work with them.

loans.use: to purchase various yarn and thread for weaving, and also to purchase a nutritional diet for her cattle.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk is 63 years old and a widow. Her husband passed away in the past few years and left with their six children. She has been in the farming business for ages since she left her parents and settled down in a new home. She also raises pigs to make extra income to supplement her living. 

With the loan she has requested, she will cover the operating costs of farming and buy a few pigs to fatten. This loan will help her with her economic development and allow her to have higher income and, in this way, to improve her familiy's lives. 

In the future, she will continue to grow her family owned farming business into a commercial one.

loans.use: to cover the operating costs of farming and buy a few pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Saibibi

texts.ru:
Сайбиби 56-летняя вдова. Она вместе с сыном, невесткой и внуком проживает в городе Душанбе. Ее сын предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту домов, а невестка занимается шитьем национальных женских платьев. Сама Сайбиби домохозяйка. Она до этого времени нигде не работала. Сейчас она хочет открыть продуктовый магазин и начать торговый бизнес. Она рядом с домом построила помещение для магазина, закупила холодильник, стеллаж, столы и одну часть продуктов питания. У нее не хватило денежной суммы, чтобы полностью закупить продукты. Поэтому Сайбиби обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она хочет купить остальные продукты питания и открыть магазин. Ей в ведении бизнеса будут помогать сын и невестка. 
Кредит позволит Сайбиби начать семейный торговый бизнес и улучшить качество жизни.
texts.en: Saibibi is a 56-year-old widow.  She, her son, daughter-in-law and grandson live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan.  Her son works in home repair and her daughter-in-law makes the national women's dress. Saibibi is a homemaker.  Up until this time, she has not worked.  She now wants to open a grocery store.  She constructed a building next to her home for the store and bought a refrigerator, shelving, tables and part of her inventory.  She doesn't have the funds to buy the rest of the products she intends to sell so she's taking out a loan.  With the loan, she'll make the rest of the necessary purchases and open the store.  Her son and daughter-in-law will help her run the business.  The loan will allow Saibibi to start her family business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food goods to open a new grocery store

loans.name: Altiboy

texts.ru:
Алтибой молодой женатый человек в возрасте 26 лет. Он является отцом одного ребенка. Алтибой проживает в районе Дж.Руми. Он занимается растениеводством на небольшом участке земли. Чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи, он хочет начать овцеводческий бизнес и совмещать его с земледельческой деятельностью. Алтибой планирует закупать и откармливать овец для продажи. Во дворе его дома есть сарай для содержания скота и 300 вязок сена. Алтибой просит кредит в размере 1500 долларов США для закупа 12 голов овец. Алтибой считает, что содержание овец не будет доставлять ему особых хлопот: это пастбищные животные, покупать им специальный корм не придётся, овцы легко разводятся, хорошо переносят морозы и среди этих животных наблюдается самая низкая смертность. 
Прибыль с бизнеса Алтибой намерен использовать на ремонт дома и улучшение бытовых условий.
texts.en: Altiboy is a married young man of 26, and is the father of one child. He lives in J.Rumy. He raises crops on a small plot of land. To improve his family's finances, he wants to start a business raising sheep and combine it with his crop-raising work. Altiboy is planning on buying and fattening sheep for later resale. He has a shed in his yard for keeping the livestock and 300 bales of hay. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 US dollars to buy 12 head of sheep. Altiboy figures that keeping sheep won't be much trouble for him; they  are grazing animals, and don't require special feed. They are easy to breed, handle the cold weather well, and are very hardy. Altiboy intends to utilize the profits from the business to repair his house and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase 12 head of sheep to start a business raising sheep.

loans.name: Mdamu

texts.en:
Mdamu is a married woman and has eight children who go to school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Mdamu has operated a kiosk business. Her potential customers are passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Yuretha

texts.en:
Yuretha is a 36-year-old woman who is married to Stefanus, a 38-year-old entrepreneur. From her marriage, Yuretha has been blessed with five children:  Sarni, 18; Yandri, 17, both of whom are high school students; Gresna, 11; Kitler, 8, both of whom are elementary school students, and Jelita, 4.

Yuretha is a housewife; her husband is a mechanic who used to work in a repair shop.  In 2002, her husband established his own home-based repair shop by using their own capital. Besides running her main task as a housewife, Yuretha assists her husband in managing the business. However, their business’ income is small, as the limitation of capital they have could not fully cover their household needs, particularly the educational fees of the children. 

Therefore, Yuretha went to TLM and asked for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000. This loan will help her to pay the educational fees of their children. She is hoping the business will be getting better and enable them to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to pay the educational fees of their children.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул, 42 года, замужем, мать-героиня, имеет 6 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста (3 сына и 3 дочери). Образование-средне-специальное. После распада колхоза в 1994 году и получив земельный надел размером 2,07 ГА начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 10000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, сажает в основном фасоль, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова. Супруг помогает по хозяйству, а также предоставляет плотнические услуги населению. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Анаркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20 000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Анаркул планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья скота, а также в будущем хочет дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en: Anarkul is 42 years old, married, and a mother to six children, school-aged and younger (three sons and three daughters).  She has a high school diploma.    After the collapse of collective farms in 1994, she received a plot of land, 2.07 hectares, on which she began farming.  She started her business with 10,000 KGS and now her monthly profit is 10,000 KGS.  She has developed her agricultural efforts and grows mostly beans.  She also works with livestock.  She has one dairy cow.  Her spouse helps her with the farm and also offers carpentry services.  With the goal of further business development, Anarkul has turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy ammonium nitrate to fertilize her land.  She plans to use the income from the loan to increase her herd and to provide her children with a worthy education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.es:
Las florecitas es un grupo integrado por 6 personas, ellos decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo porque la comunidad don de ellos viven se llama las flores. En esta comunidad la principal actividad económica es la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar.

Doña Lucina es uno de los integrantes de dicho grupo, ella tiene la edad de 53 años solo estudio 2 grado de primaria ya que cuando era pequeña en la escuela de su comunidad era el máximo grado de estudio que se impartía, ella es madre soltera de una adolescente de nombre jeimy que estudia la secundaria. 
Doña Lucína platica que por más de 20 años se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon, ella dice que quien la invito para trabaja a vender estos productos fue una maestra para la cual vendía y le daba una pequeña comisión pero un tiempo después decidío inscribirse e iniciar a vender de manera independiente ya que le dejaría más ganancias y ya tenía sus clientes. 
Ella platica que esta muy contenta ya que por medio de esta actividad a podido sacar adelante a su familia y es su propia gente de empleo. 
Un crédito de Visión Fund le ayudara a invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, sombras, delineadores, maquillajes, desodorantes y perfumes para continuar con sus ventas. 
Doña lucína quiere que en un futuro su hija pueda estudiar una carrera profesional y agradece el apoyo que se le está brindando con estos préstamos.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Ylivalda venta de Masa
Adelaida repostería 
Amalia repostería
Albertha venta de antojitos
Arely venta de ropa
texts.en:
"Las Florecitas" (The Little Flowers) is a communal bank made up of six members.  They chose the name "Las Florecitas" because the community where they live is called "Las Flores."  The main trade in their community is planting and growing sugar cane. 

Doña Lucina is one of the members of said communal bank.  She is 53-years old and only finished second grade, as the community school she attended as a little girl only went through second grade.  She is the single mother of an teenager named Jeimy, who is in secondary school.   
Doña Lucína says that for more than twenty years she has made her living selling Avon cosmetics.  She says that she was invited into the business by a teacher who was selling Avon products.  Doña Lucína was given a small commission for her sales, but after a while decided to sign up with Avon and start selling on her own.  Working independently, she was able to earn more money, and she already had a customer base. 
Doña Lucína says that she is very happy and that through her business she has been able to get her family ahead.  And she has her own team of employees.
A loan from Visión Fund will help her to invest in the purchase of nail polish, eye shadow, eye liner, makeup, deodorant and perfume to continue with her sales.
In the future, Doña lucína wants her daughter to be able to study for a professional career.  And she is grateful for the help she is being offered with these loans. 
The other members of the communal bank are:
Ylivalda, who sells dough
Adelaida, who sells pastries 
Amalia, who sells pastries
Albertha, who sells snacks
Arely, who sells clothing

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, eye shadow, eyeliner, makeup, deodorant and perfumes.

loans.name: Enea

texts.en: Enea has just finished paying off the previous loan and needs your help again to buy second-hand items to resell. Enea is very thankful to all the lenders and, "Happy Summer," is what he wishes to all. "Albania has very hot summers and we enjoy that, so wishing others about it, I feel like they will feel the same joy," Enea said.

loans.use: to add more inventory of used items to resell.

loans.name: Delmi

texts.es: Delmi, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace dos años que Delmi decidió dedicarse a su propio negocio donde vende útiles escolares como cuadernos, mochilas y otros, vende cremas, champú, maquillajes, ropa interior para damas y caballeros. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar mercadería como útiles escolares, mochilas, lápices, maquillajes y ropa interior para damas y caballeros. Con esta inversión espera mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su plan es que crezca mas el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delmi is a 32-year-old single mother with two children. She lives in a neighborhood that is part of the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.

Twelve years ago, Delmi decided to start her own business of selling school supplies such as notebooks, backpacks, and other items. She also sells crèmes, shampoo, makeup, and undergarments for women and men. This business is located in her house and is the source of income for her family.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 5,000 HNL and will be used to buy merchandise such as school supplies, backpacks, pencils, makeup, and undergarments for women and men. With this investment, she hopes to improve her sales and her income. Her plan is to grow her business even more so that her children can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, backpacks, pencils, makeup, and undergarments.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer, de 21 años, es soltero y vive con con su madre en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años, su papá le dejó a cargo de su tienda de fabricación de materiales a base de fierro, también realiza arreglos de diferentes máquinas. Comenzó su trabajo a raíz de los problemas económicos que tenía, pues se encontraba estudiando ingeniería civil, en una universidad privada, “ya no podía solventar mis gastos”, afirma. Pero Elmer, no se amilanó, muy por el contrario reunió todas las fuerzas que tiene y comenzó a trabajar en el antiguo oficio de su padre, por lo que comenzó a ayudar a su familia. Ahora desea trabajar muy duro para conseguir sus objetivos por eso trabaja sin descanso de lunes a sábado  e incluso domingos. Su objetivo, es trabajar muy duro para poder retomar sus estudios, ya que es lo que más desea en este momento.  
Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Elmer, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de varios fierros para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Elmer, 21, is single and lives with his mother in his own house.  Two years ago his father left him in charge of his metal shop.  He also fixes various machines.

He started his job because of economic problems when he was studying civil engineering in a private university.  "I wasn't able to pay my expenses any longer," he said.  Elmer wasn't daunted, however.  On the contrary, he gathered all his strength and began to work in his father's former trade, thus helping his family.

Now he wants to work hard to achieve his goals, so he works without resting from Monday through Saturday, and even Sunday.  His goal is to work hard so he can go back to school, which is what he wants most right now.

This is his second Kiva loan and he's grateful to get some financial help to get ahead with his business.  He also promises to make his payments punctually.

Elmer will invest the 1,000 soles [PEN] in a variety of metal so he can carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy metal wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Diane Fride

texts.fr: Diane est une femme de 28 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède une boutique où elle vend des produits cosmétiques dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés seront injectés dans son capital d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de famille avec son copain d'autre part.
texts.en: Diane is a 28-year-old single mother of one child. She has a shop in a district of the city where she has been selling cosmetics for the past two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of merchandise in order to increase her sales. Part of the income she earns will be used as business capital, and the rest will be used to help pay for her family's needs, along with her boyfriend.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise (cosmetics).

loans.name: Vilma Teresa

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Tiempo atrás cuando fue abandonada por su esposo, tuvo que dedicarse a alguna actividad para sacar adelante a su familia, es ahí cuando decide montar el negocio de la tienda con el cual fue creciendo poco a poco.  Trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Por ahora quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de arroz, azúcar y colas para comercializar en su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad. When her husband abandoned her some time ago, she had to engage in some type of business activity so that her family could get ahead. That’s when she decided to open a store, which has grown a little bit at a time.

The borrower works every day from 7:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. She is single and has two children who attend a state school. For now, she will invest her loan in the purchase of rice, sugar, and colas to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and colas to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 55 years old and married, with six children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Melinda aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her cafeteria. Gelyn is borrowing PHP 13.000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny, de 33 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Pedro, su esposo desde hace 13 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Marleny tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde no solo vende productos de primera necesidad. También diversos accesorios de cocina y hasta acondicionó una pequeña ferretería, donde vende clavos y demás productos. “En mi tienda encuentran de todo”, afirma. Ya que su mayor deseo es tener un supermercado, donde todo este distribuido y acondicionado. Además de su negocio, ella se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, ya tiene 70 ejemplares, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos a buen precio. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Marleny, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marleny, 33, is a happy woman.  She lives with Pedro, her husband of 13 years.  Together they have three children who live with them in their own home.

Marleny has a grocery store where she sells staple items as well as kitchen accessories.  She even set up a small hardware store to sell nails and other products.  "In my store you can find everything," she said.  Her biggest desire is to have a supermarket where everything is organized and set up.

In addition to her business she raises guinea pigs, which she fattens and sells for a good price.  Currently she has 70 guinea pigs.

This is her second Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial help she's receiving so she can get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

Marleny will invest the 1500 soles [PEN] in staples for her grocery store: rice, sugar, milk, flour, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, and other food

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa. Hace 3 años Blanca se dedica a vender ropa usada, herramientas de trabajo y artículos para el hogar usados. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar mercadería para la venta como ropa, herramientas y artículos del hogar usados. Su objetivo es tener variedad de productos en su negocio para mejorar la clientela.
texts.en:
Blanca is 60 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in the municipality of San Francisco de Yojoa. For the last 3 years, Blanca has been dedicated to selling used clothing, work tools, and used household articles. Her store is located in her home.

The loan Blanca has solicited is for 10,000 Lempiras, to be used to purchase merchandise to sell, such as clothing, tools, and used household items. 

Blanca's objective is to supply her business with a variety of products in order to attract a better clientele.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell, including clothing, tools, and used household articles.

loans.name: Miriam Janethe

texts.es: Miriam, tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su  hijo en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene dos años de tener un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios como ser granos básicos, azúcar, pan, lácteos, huevos, churros, refrescos, condimentos etc. además vende productos de ferretería como ser herramientas y materiales para construcción. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por  6,000 Lempiras, el cual lo utilizara para comprar cemento para la venta y mejorar sus ingresos. Su plan es  mejorar el  nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Miriam is 38 years old and lives with her husband and son in the town of San Pedro Sula.  She has had this business for two years, where she sells foodstuffs such as basic grains, sugar, bread, milk products, eggs, churros, soft drinks, condiments, etc.  She also sells hardware such as tools and building materials.  She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Lempiras, which she will use to buy cement for resale so she can increase her income.  Her plan is to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement for resale.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
It is the first time for Chuon to be a Kiva borrower and appear on the website. She has been with HKL for two times including this loan. Chuon, aged 32, is married and a mother of four children, all of whom are still dependent. She is a resident of Prey Chor district, where she and her spouse help each other cultivate land for growing rice. 

Chuon has taken a loan for KHR 2,000,000 to build a latrine for her household. She will buy construction materials needed and pay for labor costs. This will enable her to build a healthy family and protect her family members from unexpected illness. The previous loan was successfully repaid. Her hopes and dreams are to grow economically and socially.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her household.

loans.name: Ileje Group

texts.en:
Laurence, who is in his early 30s, is single with a daughter who is in school. For five years now, Laurence has had different food activities--chips, soft drinks and water. He works from noon to 12 midnight daily and is able to make a good profit per month. This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to buy a business freezer, TV and chairs.  He dreams that one day he will be able to improve his business a lot by having a good working environment and using modem equipment (a gas stove, tables, etc.)
 
He will share this loan with his loan group "Ileje" which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business freezer, TV and chairs.

loans.name: Hedjara

texts.en:
Hedjara is a 33-year-old married woman with an only child. She lives in Kinuman, Ozamiz City with her family. Her husband is earning through a service- based business; he has been providing motorcycle transportation for two years. Aside from this, as their main source of income, they grow corn and bananas for sale. 

Hedjara joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy a new set of tires. She plans to acquire another motorcycle to be used for expansion. She saves her generated revenue to be used for home improvement in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Vanadzor town and is a mother of three children. 

Gayane is a baker and works at local bakery. She works hard to gather a good income and sustain her children's living. Because of financial challenges that her family is currently facing, Gayane's husband went abroad to find a job and financially support his family. 

Gayane's elder daughter, Gohar (in the photo), studies at Vanadzor State Medical College. Unfortunately, the family's income is too low to cover Gohar's education fee. So, Gayane has applied for this loan to cover the university tuition of her daughter and to give her an opportunity to complete her education.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 52 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aurora has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future Aurora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
Thérèse, âgée de 53 ans, est veuve. Elle a trois enfants – dont deux sont décédés jeunes – et deux petits enfants qui vont à la maternelle. 
Depuis 15 ans, Thérèse élève des porcs et des poulets dans sa cour, malgré les difficultés rencontrées pour les nourrir et la maladie qui ravage les poules. Elle cultive également son champ, et depuis quelques mois, revend les produits Nafa Naana au sein son association. 
Le prêt octroyé à Thérèse lui permet d’acquérir 16 foyers à gaz, 2 foyers améliorés et 2 lampes solaires, pour les revendre au sein de son association. Cette activité est importante pour Thérèse car elle considère que cela va changer beaucoup de choses dans les familles : « beaucoup de femmes seront déchargées du fardeau des dépenses en énergie ».
Thérèse est inquiète pour l’avenir : étrangère dans son quartier, elle n’est pas sûre d’obtenir une parcelle lorsque le quartier sera loti. Mais elle ne se décourage pas, son rêve est de faire l’élevage de moutons, et elle est certaine que ses activités avec Nafa Naana la pousseront à aller de l’avant.
texts.en:
Thérèse, aged 53, is a widow. She has three children - two of whom died young - and two grandchildren who go to kindergarten.
For 15 years, Thérèse has been raising pigs and chickens in her yard, despite the difficulties encountered in feeding them, and the disease that decimates her chickens. She also cultivates her field, and in recent months has begun reselling Nafa Naana products in her area.

This loan will allow Thérèse to acquire 16 gas stoves, two energy-efficient stoves, and two solar lamps for resale within her association. This business is important for Thérèse because she thinks that they will change many things for local families: "Many women will be relieved of the burden of energy costs."

Thérèse is concerned for her future. A stranger in her district, she is not sure that she will be able to get a parcel when the area is subdivided. But she will not be discouraged. Her dream is to raise sheep, and she is certain that her business with Nafa Naana will push her to move forward.

loans.use: to resell energy-efficient and gas stoves, and solar lamps.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of flower making for many years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and for events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies them at the local market. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. 

Tasleem is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy raw materials including wire, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paint, glace paper and tissue paper. In this way she would be able to meet with the increasing demand of her customers consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including wire, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paint, glace paper and tissue paper.

loans.name: Burbuqe

texts.en:
Burbuqe has been running a local bar-café in her village for almost six years now and she is requesting a loan at the moment to buy inventory items for this store. 

“This is not my first loan, it is my eighth, but I have paid off the previous ones. The thing is that I find loans very handy, while it is very difficult, most of the time, to save some for the rainy days. We also operate some agricultural activities and we generate something from there too. I am planning to add a bit more to this store, to offer some basic traditional food to serve, but let’s see,” said Burbuqe.

Burbuqe is a married mother of a 19-year-old child who continues studies at a public university.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for the bar-cafe.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 43-year-old married woman. From the past two years she has been selling spices which are used in cooking food. She purchases spices in bulk from the wholesale market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good quality spices in her locality and earns enough to spend a decent life. She is a responsible mother of two children and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. 

For this reason she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan, age 50, is a married woman. She is successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has been doing it for a period of about five years. She offers a variety of goods to the people of her locality and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 which she will use to buy packs of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been working hard to provide better living standards to her family by running a general store for many years. Her store is located at the corner of her house where she offers variety of grocery items and daily-use goods. She makes enough income to spend a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy more packs of sugar, sweets, biscuits and beverages. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good loan history. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy more packs of sugar, sweets, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 45 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Alejandro con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con una de ellas en una casa alquilada. Elena se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, en los terrenos agrícolas que alquila anualmente, siembra diversos productos como papa y maíz, pero tambien obtiene ingresos económicos de la crianza de animales menores como: cuyes, cerdos y gallinas por eso posee un gran número de ejemplares por lo que tiene que dedicar una parcela exclusivamente para la siembra de alfalfa, pues cada 15 días comercializa los cuyes a una empresa exportadora, como también los animales menores que cría a los carniceros de la zona. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Elena, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old and a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Alejandro with whom she has 4 children. They live in a rented house and just one of the children still depends on them.

Elena dedicates herself to farming and livestock raising on lands she rents annually. She plants diverse crops including potatoes and corn, and she also obtains economic income from raising farm animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. She has a number of farm animals and, therefore, must dedicate a parcel of her land exclusively to growing alfalfa. Every 15 days, she sells guinea pigs to an export enterprise, and the other farm animals she raises are sold to butchers in the zone.

This is Elena's 1st loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial aid which will help her forge ahead. Moreover, she is committed to making her payments punctually.

Elena will invest the 500 sols in the purchase of organic manure to nourish her alfalfa crop.

loans.use: buy organic manure for her alfalfa crop that will feed her farm animals.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 42 años de edad, está casado con Esther y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Juan se dedica a transportar pasajeros, por eso cuenta con un mototaxi que compró inicialmente para el transporte de frutas de sus vecinos, pero  por la demanda de pasajeros decidió empezar a transportar personas, haciendo su ruta por las calles de la ciudad, uniendo varios sectores de la comunidad. Lleva un promedio de 4 años en está actividad.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite conocer diversos lugares de la ciudad, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para solventar los gastos de su familia. Desea comprar otra unidad móvil para poder alquilarlo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, desea invertir en la compra de 03 llantas vehiculares para su mototaxi y tambien en el mantenimiento del mismo.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and married to Esther. They have two children and live in their own home. Juan provides transportation services to his passengers. For this reason, he has a motorcycle taxi that he originally purchased for transporting fruit to his neighbors. Due to the demand from passengers, he decided to switch his business to transporting people. He makes his own route through the streets of the city, stopping in various parts of the community. Juan has been in this business for approximately four years.

He enjoys his business because it allows him to become familiar with different parts of the city. In addition, the income he generates is used to cover his family’s expenses. Juan would like to buy another vehicle that he can offer for rent. This is his first Kiva loan and he appreciates the financial support that has received so that he can press forward. In addition, he promises to submit his payments in a punctual manner.

With the amount of 1,500 PEN that he requested, Juan will invest in the purchase of three tires for his motorcycle taxi and also pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.use: to purchase three tires for his motorcycle taxi and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a married man with three children. One of his children is in school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwero has operated a kiosk business from home for the past year, selling to passersby and neighbours. He cited capital as his challenge. 

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and rice. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Sabran

texts.en:
Sabran, age 47, deals in the business of animal sales; she buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income.  She is a dedicated mother of three. 

Sabran needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another cow. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Jeta

texts.en:
Jeta is a widowed Egyptian Albanian who has two grown-up children and together they live in a city in northern Albania. She is a long-time client of VisionFund Albania. For the past sixteen years, she has been selling second-hand clothes at the city market where they live. 

Here it is what Jeta said to the loan officer; “Throughout the years and my financial struggles, I have found the VFA and its staff to be of tremendous help. Things would have been so difficult for me and my family without this institution. Not only that I have secured food for my family through the selling of used clothes that I got with a loan from VFA, but I have also been able to add another room to my existing little family house. That is not little help.”

Jeta is now requesting another loan to buy used items to resell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is 51 years old and a married woman; she has been running a business of milk sales with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She has become famous by providing good quality milk and has retained regular customers. 

Irshad has five children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make bigger profits, Irshad requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Motia

texts.en:
Motia is a 22-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors with  packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Christiane

texts.fr:
Christiane a 41 ans. Elle est mariée avec 4 enfants. Les 3 plus âgés sont au lycée et ont eu leur BEPC : c’est sa fierté !
Christiane a commencé à exercer une activité génératrice de revenus il y a 10 ans, pour aider son mari à supporter les charges familiales et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Aujourd’hui, elle vend des habits teints et des savons qu’elle fabrique au sein de son association de femmes. Elle commercialise aussi du bois qu’elle stocke chez elle et élève des chèvres et des porcs dans sa cour.
Le prêt octroyé à Christiane lui permet d’acquérir 16 foyers à gaz et 10 foyers améliorés, pour les revendre au sein de son association. Cela lui permet de diversifier son activité et de gagner plus d’argent grâce aux produits vendus.

Cela permettra à ses enfants de continuer leurs études, afin qu’ils réalisent leurs projets très précis : l’une veut devenir militaire, un autre chef d’entreprise et le 3e juge. Quant à elle, elle souhaite ouvrir sa propre boutique pour vendre les produits Nafa Naana dans son quartier…
texts.en:
Christiane is 41 years old. She is married with four children. The older three are in high school and have earned their BEPC (a diploma given to French pupils at the end of 3ème/year 10/ninth grade): they are her pride!

Christiane began a business ten years ago to help her husband with the family expenses and pay school fees for her children. Today, she sells dyed clothing and soaps that she makes herself to the women in her association. She also sells timber that she stores at her home, and raises goats and pigs in her yard.

This loan will allow Christiane to acquire 16 gas stoves and ten energy-efficient stoves, to resell within her association. This allows her to diversify her business and earn more money through their sales. This will also allow her children to continue their education so that they can accomplish their very specific dreams: one wants to join the military, another wants to run a business, and the third wants to become a judge. As for Christiane, she wants to open her own shop to sell Naana Nafa products in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase gas and energy-efficient stoves for resale.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 48-year-old married woman; she has been actively involved in the business of milk sales, with the support of her husband, for a period of about of 20 years. She has ten buffaloes which she milks, and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She is the mother of six children; one of her sons also works in a sports factory to support his family. 

Parveen needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, such as food, clothing, and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy one more buffalo. 

She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room for expanding her business and to buy equipment.

loans.name: Firdous

texts.en:
Firdous is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for the past eight years.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is the mother of five children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

Firdous is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar, age 37, is a married woman. She has been stitching gloves for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has become famous by providing good-quality gloves. She earns enough to lead a decent life through her business. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Kausar requested a loan of PKR 15,000/- to buy bundles of cotton and nylon, with more spools of white thread and needles. She is in her second loan cycle, with a good loan history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cotton and nylon, with more spools of white thread and needles.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta has a boutique business in Kangundo town. She sells clothes, shoes and beauty products. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable.

This being her first loan term, she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes and beauty products to sell. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to buy more variety of clothes and shoes in her boutique and become successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 61 years old and married with 4 children. She rears cattle as well as doing cash crop farming. She has been in this business for the past 20 years. Her husband also provides additional income to support the family.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting on her farm. She also plans to buy cow feed for her cattle. She will use the generated income to buy another dairy cow.

She hopes to have more dairy cows and become successful in her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and cow feed

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan is 58 years old, married to Chheang, and supporting a family of seven members. Kan’s family utterly relies on the income from farming activities, which are managed by her and her husband on their own pieces of land. She focuses on the rice, beans, and other seasonal crops due to fertile land and good climatic conditions in her areas. She has been involved in this for 35 years.

Kan would like to borrow a loan of 300 US dollars through HKL, a reliable institute in the areas she has recognized through its credit officer. She will utilize the loan to build a latrine and water storage to keep enough water for domestic use. 

She thanks lenders for the loan, since it will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a latrine and water storage to keep enough water for domestic use.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Béatrice a 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Deux jumeaux sont en classe de CP, et le plus âgé fréquente déjà l’Université. 
Christiane est entrepreneuse depuis sept années, ainsi que Présidente d’une association. Elle propose des activités de traiteur, de décoration et d’aménagement du paysage, mais doit faire face à un manque de financements pour développer son activité.
Le prêt octroyé à Christiane lui permet d’acquérir 18 foyers à gaz et 1 foyer amélioré, pour les revendre au sein de son association. Elle fait cela pour soulager les femmes de son association qui pourront désormais cuisiner plus rapidement.
Pour l’avenir, Béatrice souhaiterait mettre en place une structure de microfinance qui soutiendrait la cause des femmes.
texts.en:
Béatrice is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her twins are in primary school and her older child is already at the university. 

Christiane has been an entrepreneur for seven years and also president of an association. She would like to be doing work as a caterer or decorator or landscape gardener, but has deal with a lack of finances to develop those businesses. 

The loan accorded to Christiane will allow her to buy 18 gas stoves and one improved woodstove to resell within her association. She does this to help the women of her association out, so that they will be able to cook food more quickly. 

As for the future, Béatrice would like to set up a microfinance organization that would support women.

loans.use: to resell gas stoves and improved woodstoves.

loans.name: Eyea

texts.en:
Eyea, 49 years old, lives and works in Buchanan, which is located by the sea and the capital City of Grand Bassa County. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically consumed with soup or sauce.

Eyae, who is married to a contractor, is the mother of four children between 28 and 14 years of age, only two of whom are in school and live at home. Although she didn't have the good fortune to attend school, Eyae is a hardworking businesswoman; for the past 13 years, in order to help her children, she has been selling used clothes in the local market, a business she learned from her mother.

Now requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business, Eyae's dream is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is a 46-year-old married mother of four children aged 19, 17, 16 and 14 years respectively. She earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. 

Her goal is to fully stock her shop in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. Dorris is requesting a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will reinvest in her business and use the remaining amount to repay her loan. 

In the future, Dorris plans to continue to invest in her business, to eventually operate a larger wholesale store and to offer her children quality educations.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 49-year-old, married mother of two, in Thika, earns a living for her family by selling second-hand clothes. Her spouse, John, is also a businessman. 

Due to limited income to fund her business, Grace has been unable to expand her business. That is why she decided to request a loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to purchase more bales of clothes, thus expanding her customer base which, in return, will increase her sales and profits. 

With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will save for her children’s education and repay her loan. 

In the future, Grace would like to continue to invest in her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 25-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands for food, health, clothing, and education. She has been sewing gloves for many years. She sews for the people in her community and the local market. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy a new sewing machine with more spools of thread and fabrics, such as cotton and nylon in various colors. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread and fabric.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 45-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: one of her sons owns a mobile shop in which he offers mobile accessories to his customers, such as phone batteries and hands-free devices, and refills the phone cards of different telecommunication networks. Her husband is doing business in LDA and both are contributing to the household expenses and monthly savings. 
She requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 for her son so that he could buy phone cards for his mobile shop.
This is her first loan; she assured us that she will pay her all installments on time.
Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy phone cards of different networks.

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en:
Fakhra is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of six children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure, so she decided to initiate her own business to support her family for a better future. 

Fourteen years ago she started her general store business. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 25,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 32 years old, and a vigorous married woman. She has had a business doing machine embroidery for the past three years. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her locality and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. She is a mother of five children and needs to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials such as thread (in various colors), frames, sequins and needles to meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread (in various colors), frames, sequins and needles.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 45-year-old married woman. She runs a small general store in her community. She offers a variety of good quality products at reasonable prices and earns a good amount of income to support her family. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is a 50-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. One year ago, she started a sewing business to support her family. She stitches gloves in different sizes and earns enough to support a decent life.  To improve her business she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy bundles of cotton and nylon with more spools of white thread and needles. She is in her second loan cycle with a good loan history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cotton and nylon with more spools of white thread and needles.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 28-year-old, married woman. 

One year ago, she started her own business of cloth sales when her husband got severely ill. She started buying cloth of different designs and colors from the market, in bulk, at lower rates, to sell in her community. She has a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She is mother of six children; two of them are school-going. She wishes to send other children to school, but she is unable to cover the expenses. 

For the improvement of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a wide collection of cloth, in different colors and designs. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of profits on providing a quality education to her children, for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy a wide collection of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a maried woman with three children, one of whom goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Charity has operated a milk selling business for the last four years. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase gallon containers for milk. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase gallon containers for milk.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en: Shagufta is a 26-year-old single lady. For the past two years she is happily stitching gloves to support her family. She is very expert in stitching gloves in different designs and sizes and has become famous by providing good quality services. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. For the further improvement of the business she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy a new sewing machine with more reels of white thread. She is in her third loan cycle with a good loan history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and more reels of white thread.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 47 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. Rita has a store that sells a variety of products: soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for five (5) years.
