texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to buy bales of clothes for her clothes-selling business. In addition, she is requesting a loan of Ksh.10,000 to renovate her clothing shop by renovating the roof.

loans.use: to renovate her clothing shop by renovating the roof.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Сабохат является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом. Сабохат давно мечтала иметь своё дело и стать экономически не зависимой. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult times can make a person concentrate all their efforts and use their existing resources.  Sabohat is one of those people who tries to improve her living conditions and to enhance her family's economic standing.  She is married and is raising three children.  Her husband is in business.  Sabohat has dreamed for a long time about having her own business and becoming economically independent.  

It was with this goal in mind that Sabohat studied in the "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" course that is put on by the Organization of Business Women and she earned her certificate of completion.  Now she is completely able to start her own business and be successful in her field.  She wants to start a business in trading cattle since she has experience with this.  She is planning to use the profit she earns to provide her children with good educations and high calorie foods.  She is requesting a loan of 500 somoni (TJS) to buy cattle to start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Esmeralda 27 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ESMERALDA 27,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,   el presidente del banco es el Sr. Jose tiene 44 años, casado con dos  hijos  que ya son mayores de edad,  su actividad económica es venta de adornos hechos de mármol, el se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, el destino del crédito es para la compra de variedad de adornos de mármol por mayor para surtir sus productos, el Sr. Jose es una persona trabajadora, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado,  el deseo del Sr. Jose es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos como también incrementar su clientela para generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The ESMERALDA 27 communal bank has eight members, six women and two men. The president is Jose. He is 44 years old, married with two grown children. For a long time now he has sold ornaments made out of marble. This loan will be used to buy a variety of marble ornaments to give him more variety in his offerings. Jose is a hardworking person and this is his only source of income. He is very grateful to Emprender for the support it offers. His dream is to have a store where he can offer a variety of products and increase his clientele in order to increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy marble ornaments.

loans.name: Nelda Aracely

texts.es: Nelda, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años y ofrece tortillas de maíz. Inicio este negocio con el propósito de ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras el cual será invertido en la compra de productos para la venta de tortillas como es la harina de maíz. También utilizara parte del préstamo para arreglar la galera donde tiene su hornilla para brindar mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es seguir trabajando para poderles dar mejor estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Nelda is 29 years old, married and has three children. She lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. She has had a business selling tortillas for the last two years. She makes corn tortillas. She started this business as a means to help pay the household expenses. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Lempiras, which will be used to buy products to make the tortillas such as corn flour. She will use part of the loan to  fix up the area where she has the oven in order to better serve her clients. Her goal is to continue working in order to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas and to repair the area with the oven where she makes the tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Gulhinamo

texts.ru: Гулхинамо 21 года. Она не замужем и живёт с родителями на севере Таджикистана. Она умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Гулхинамо училась успешно в средней школе, но по семейным обстоятельствам, она не смогла поступить в университет. Она обучилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Она уже в течение нескольких лет имеет опыта в сфере шитья и кройки. Она уверенна, в себе, что может самостоятельно организовать свой бизнес, шитьём женской одежды. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulhinamo is 21 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents in northern Tajikistan.  She is smart and hard working young woman.  Gulhinamo studied successfully in high school, but because of family circumstances, she was not able to enter the university.  She learned to sew women's clothes from a dress maker.  She already has several years experience in fabric cutting and sewing.  

She is confident that she can start a business sewing women's clothing on her own.  She studied in the course called  "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" that is put on by the Association of Business Women, and she earned her completion certificate.  Gulhinamo is requesting a loan of 500 somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her new business

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.ru: Алфия добросовестная женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она разведена и имеет 2 детей. Детям 23 и 22 года. Она вырастила детей сама, так как после развода ей не на кого было надеяться. Алфия решила организовать свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды, так как ей очень нравилось купить детям одежду, и она мечтала начать бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Она участвовала на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она много научилась из данного курса. Она не имеет средства для покупки детской одежды для того, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки детской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Alfiya is a conscientious woman. She is 50 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Her children are 23 and 22 years old. She brought up her children by herself since after the divorce she had no one to count on. Alfiya has decided to launch a business buying and reselling children’s clothing, since she used to enjoy shopping for her children’s clothes, and   would dream of having her own business selling children’s clothing. She has completed a “Reach for Success” course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and obtained a certificate of completion. She learned a lot from this course. She lacks the means to stock up on children’s clothing and launch her business. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000 TJS to buy children’s clothing. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for launching a new business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a 29 year old single mother of two from Thika, earns a living and supports her family by operating a tailoring shop. She has been in this business for the past four years and earns a monthly income of 13,400 KES. 

This marks Joyce's third loan from KADET LTD and she is grateful for the support she has been receiving, which has made it possible to grow her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more clothing materials to make clothes for her customers. The additional income created will allow her to improve her family's standard of living and invest in her children’s education. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to college level.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing materials.

loans.name: Lilik

texts.en:
Lilik lives in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region. Lilik graduated from Kapan Medical College with a specialty in nursing, but she has never worked as a nurse. Lilik is married and she has two school-aged sons. Her husband works as a driver. 

Lilik has been engaged in a clothes-selling business for eight years. At first she worked from her house. After saving some money and gaining a lot of loyal customers, she decided to rent a small stall and enlarge her business. Lilik sells children's and women's clothes, women's underwear and a large variety of shoes. She buys products for her stall from Yerevan wholesale markets with the help of her husband.  

Lilik has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy seasonal clothes for children and women. She hopes very much that this loan will bring a decent income to her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for children and women

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 28 years old. He is married to Monicah and they are blessed with one child. 

Daniel has been selling clothes for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of 120,000 KES. He has seen his business grow steadily and now has requested a second loan of 65,000 KES to introduce a new line of clothing. The profit he earns from his business will help him expand this business, which is also his dream.

loans.use: To purchase bales of blouses and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia appreciates for the loan she was given that enabled her to buy some household items to sell. She is requesting another loan of 30,000 KES to purchase different types of utensils to meet high customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase different types of utensils to meet customer demand

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 47 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities of Liberia that is well known. She is unmarried and has four children between the ages of  9 and 23, including some who are in school and live at home. Mamie did not attend school. For the past six years, she has been running a store where she sells fashion clothes such as jeans and blouses, and African clothes such as dresses, blouses and slippers. She started this business with her small savings and established it by learning the ways of selling from her friends. She likes her business because she makes a profit and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more fashion clothes and African clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fashion clothes and African clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 46 years old, married to Joseph Cheptumo and they are blessed with eight children ranging in age from 6 to 20. She has been managing her livestock and selling milk in large quantities for five years. Her monthly income is 6000 KES.

This loan of 20000 KES is her ninth wth KADET Ltd. She has repaid previous loans successfully. She wishes to use this amount to purchase dairy feed for her livestock.The anticipated profits will be used to start different business.

Her hope and dream is to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her livestock business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a very hard-working woman.She lives in Kenya and owns a vegetable stall. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to expand her existing business. She plans to purchase fruits and potatoes, onions and other vegetables for her business to meet high customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables, including potatoes and onions, for her business

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is married and has been blessed with two school-age children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells water. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase four bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Beti

texts.en: Beti is a hardworking woman who owns a vegetable stall in Kenya. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase vegetables, fruits, spices and tomatoes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, spices and tomatoes for her business.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Emiliano tiene 46 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, conocida nacionalmente como la arenosa o curramba la bella. Vive con su conyugue y tres hijos, dos (2) varones de dieciséis (16) y dieciocho (18) años, y una niña de ocho (8) años de edad. Su actividad de negocio es la elaboración de cuadros y adornos en yeso, que vende en los municipios de los departamentos del Atlántico, Cesar y Bolívar, a través de vendedores que visitan estas poblaciones, ejerciendo labores de venta y cobro de lunes a sábados, de ocho (8) de la mañana a seis (6) de la noche. Desde hace siete (7) años inició esta actividad, que aprendió como ayudante, y luego se independizó; junto con su conyugue y sus hijos trabajan en el taller. Las compra de los materiales las hace de contado, y las ventas en las dos modalidades, crédito y contado. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de materias primas como yeso, madera, pintura, lona y vidrios, para la elaboración de cuadros, espejos, y adornos. Como meta del negocio tiene ampliar el número de clientes, personalmente, la de adquirir una casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Emiliano is 46 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla in the department of Atlántico. Barranquilla is known nationally as "la arenosa" [the sandy] or "curramba la bella" [slang for "Barranquilla the beautiful"]. Emiliano lives with his wife and three children; two boys who are sixteen and eighteen years old, and a daughter who is eight.

Emiliano's business is the creation of plaster paintings and decorations which he sells in the municipalities of the departments of Atlántico, Cesar and Bolívar. He makes his sales via vendors who visit those areas, and he himself works on sales and collecting money Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. He started this business seven years ago. He learned as an apprentice and later became independent. Today he, his wife and their sons work in the shop. They purchase all of the materials in cash, and they sell both for cash and on credit.

This is Emiliano's first Kiva credit with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to purchase raw materials such as plaster, wood, paint, canvas and glass. He will use these to create paintings, mirrors and decorations.

Emiliano's goal for the business is to increase the number of customers; his personal goal is to acquire a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as plaster, wood, canvas and glass which will be used to create paintings, mirrors and decorations.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is 59 years old, married and a mother of two children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about 5,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from the business. 

Tabu was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her third loan of 10,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, onions and so on to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as continue expanding the business. 

Tabu's goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may help uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates the loan she was given that helped her improve her living standards and also pay school fees for her children.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to enable her to expand the existing fish business by buying more fish, cooking oil, firewood and spices.

loans.use: to expand the existing fish business by buying more fish, cooking oil, firewood and spices.

loans.name: Ovidio Omar

texts.es: Ovidio, tiene 29 años de edad, el vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura en cultivo de granos básicos. Hace 5 años decidió por dedicarse a la cría y destazo de cerdos, el prepara la carne para vender. Su esposa tiene una pulpería pequeña y le ayuda a vender la carne. El préstamo que Ovidio solicito es por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar cerdos y alimentos como el concentrado para cerdos. Su plan es seguir creciendo y con el préstamo podrá comprar de contado para obtener mejor ganancia, y podrá ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the municipality of Victoria in Yoro, Honduras. He had always worked in agriculture, cultivating basic staples, until he decided 5 years ago to begin raising and butchering pigs. He also prepares the meat for sale. His wife owns a small shop and helps him sell the meat.

He requests a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to purchase pigs and food, such as concentrated pig feed. His plan is to continue growing. He will use this loan to make those purchases with cash, which will enable him to retain greater earnings and thereby help his children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.ru: Нозанин женщина с большой буквой. Она родила и воспитывает 6 детей. У нее прекрасные дети и любимый муж. Нозанин всю жизнь была домохозяйкой и нигде не работала. Она всегда мечтала иметь свое дело и принести доход семье. Она посоветовалась с мужем и участвовала на курсе «Добейся успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин, так как ее муж поддержал ее. После участия она получила сертификат. Она планирует организовать бизнес скотоводством. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Nozanin is a real woman, with a capital W.   She is married to a beloved husband and has given birth to and raised six beautiful children.  Nozanin has been a homemaker all her life and has never worked outside of her house.  However, she has always dreamed about having her own business and bringing some income for her family.  After consulting with her husband, and since he was very supportive, she decided to take part in a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Association of Business Women and from which she has earned a certificate. 

Nozanin is now planning to start her own animal-husbandry business and is requesting a loan of 500 somoni to buy some cattle.  She is awaiting your kindness and hoping for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy some cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Medalith

texts.es: Medalith, de 34 años de edad, esta casada con Luís quien es comerciante y padre de sus 02 hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Medalith se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo mano que compra en los centros comerciales de la ciudad, para luego venderlo en los pueblos que quedan cerca de los rios, logrando que los pobladores compren sus prendas.Se inició hace más de 7 años con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros y hasta el momento lo viene realizando ella sola. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles comprará ropa de segunda mano al por mayor para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Medalith is 34 years old and married to Luís, who is a merchant and the father of their two children (ages 18 and 12 respectively). They live in their own home. Medalith sells secondhand clothing which she buys at the shopping centers in the city. She then sells them in the towns near the rivers so that the villagers can buy these products. Medalith started her business more than seven years ago with her own capital that she had saved. Up to this moment she has worked alone.

This is her first Kiva loan and she is appreciative of the financial support she has received so that she can continue forward. In addition, she promises to submit her payments in a punctual manner. The amount of 800 PEN that she requested will be used to buy secondhand clothing in bulk for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Panta-on, Ozamiz City, with her family. Her husband is a farmer who plants and harvest banana, root crops, and corn. Melanie has helped him in the farm doing this for many years to earn a living. Aside from this, she also manages a general store selling goods in their community to gain extra income. 
Melanie joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and it helped her to improve her ability to engage in business. She borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer and a portion will be used to buy additional canned goods and noodles. She plans to expand her store and is hopeful of improving their living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase manure to use as fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Sarah is married and has three children. To make a living, her husband goes fishing, while Sarah sells used products such as ready-to-wear clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, lotions and many other products. Sarah has been in her business for 10 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. Sarah joined GDMPC in 2008 and is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more stocks of lotion and perfumes etc to sell. A portion of this loan will be used to buy a new fishing net. Sarah plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lotion and perfumes etc to sell

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is very greatful for the previous loan she got from Kiva, which helped her increase her stock and also improved her living standards.

She is asking for a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase khangas (women's clothes) and to pay for transportation costs for her business.

loans.use: to purchase khangas (women's clothes) and to pay for transportation costs for her business.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima has four children and owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees for her children. 

Mwanalima operates a tailoring business, making suits for both men and women. She sells at the market to local neighbors and passersby. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase clothing material, sewing threads and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material, sewing threads and needles.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a water vendor and a landlord who resides in the informal settlement of Mukuru in Nairobi, Kenya. She is a mother of four and a hardworking community member. Miriam learned about Fresh Life toilets after using one near her residence and saw them as a great business opportunity. Miriam wishes to buy two toilets to build upon her existing business ventures. 

Miriam is seeking a loan to fund the purchase of two Fresh Life toilets. Impressed by the impact that existing Fresh Life toilets have had in her community, she wishes to be part of the Fresh Life movement, which has benefited the residents of Mukuru by providing a safer, cleaner environment.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a single man living in Kenya. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and water.
For the last eight months, Isaac has been operating a business of selling household products from door-to-door. His major challenge is transportation costs to cater for his movements while in business.
With the loan that he is requesting, Isaac wants to purchase household products such as plates, jugs, cups, and cutlery. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase household products such as plates, jugs, cups, and cutlery.

loans.name: Betty Sallah

texts.en: Betty is a client of Finance South Sudan. She is 25 years old and a mother of 4 children. Betty is a businesswoman who operates a merchandise shop that sells items like sugar, salt, cooking oil, food additives, soft drinks, and many other items. She has been in the business for about 5 years now. Betty is borrowing a loan worth 1000 South Sudanese Pounds to help her buy more stock and expand her business. She will use her profits to pay back the loan. She believes that this loan will be beneficial to her in the business and improve the lives of her children.

loans.use: To buy merchandise goods like sugar, salt, soft drinks and others

loans.name: Al-Khlood Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Khlood and consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Khlood is a married woman and has five children. She only studied through to primary school. One of her children has a small electronics shop with which he tries his best to cover household expenses. Recently, the business of Khlood's son has not been running well. So, Khlood thinks of assisting her son to stock up with electronic materials. Khlood is therefore requesting a loan from AMB to help her son with covering the cost of purchasing electronic materials in order to increase profit for his business. Taking this loan will offer a more comfortable living.

loans.use: to help her son with covering the cost of purchasing electronic materials in order to increase profit for his business.

loans.name: Shafeeq Group

texts.en: This group, which is called Shafeeq, consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Nour is a widow and has six children. She received her husband's salary when he died. She said, the salary is not enough to cover her children expenses. She has a small home. Nour would like to complete building her house. She applied for a loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to complete building her house. She dreams of improving her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete building her house.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en: Ronelyn is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married, and has one child. Ronelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs to sell. She has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ronelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Malindi, Kenya. He is married. For two years he has been running a retail shop in his neighborhood. He sells cereals, cooking oil, soap and other retail products. He is also a mechanic and he repairs motorbikes and services them for an income. He has ambitions of opening up a wholesale shop and expanding his small garage to a bigger one in five years time. The challenge in the retail shop business is people taking goods on credit and not paying on time. 

He heard of Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy rice, flour, cooking oil and more retail products for his shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish, paraffin, cooking oil and firewood for her fish business which will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more fish, paraffin, cooking oil and firewood for her fish business that will help her to invest back into her business.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is married, and has three kids who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, Biasha has operated a motorcycle transport business. Her major challenge is rainy season which makes her motorcycle difficult to operate.

With the KES 50,000 Biasha wants to add onto her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add onto her savings and purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Yemen-Jadid Group

texts.en: This group is called  Yemen-Jadid and consists of four women. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER. Amal is president of this group. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen. Amal is a teacher and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover her needs. However, she works hard daily, and she loves her career because she teaches students who will be successful in the future. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance her skills in using the computer and speed the process of doing reports for her work which will ensure better conditions for her work.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for her online business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking man who practices farming and milking as part of his daily life. Joseph is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase two cows that would help him ease up with his farming business and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase two cows that would help him ease up with his farming business and generate more income

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin appreciates the loan he was given that enabled him to generate profits that he used to pay school fees for his children.
He is requesting for a loan of 10,000  KES to purchase vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, and onions for his business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, and onions for his business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 42 years old and lives in the Paynesville south, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. Annie is married and has five children between the ages of one month to 12 years old. They all live at home and only four attend school.

Annie herself was unfortunate with attending school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years Annie has been selling slippers in the local market, and now she faces no problems. She sells every day and spends 10 hours with her business. Annie started this business with a little income that she received from her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Annie hopes to build her house. She thanks the lenders of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Darla

texts.en:
As a college instructor, Darla’s interactions with local medical professionals encouraged her to find a solution to help lower the high unemployment rate and improve local training opportunities. Darla, who holds a PhD in Health Education, and her husband Michael, a certified health instructor, opened their own business in 2011. 

WNC Edutech’s mission is to provide education for people on the brink of losing their jobs, as well as those aspiring to advance their careers. The couple works to certify individuals as medical administrative assistants, clinical medical assistants, EKG techs, surgical techs, medical lab assistants, patient care techs, and electronic health record specialists, billing and coding specialists and in CPR. Michael also makes sure all students understand basic computer software such as Microsoft Word, Excel, how to send professional emails and create a resume with his/ her updated certifications.

To learn more, visit their website at http://www.wncedutech.com/#

loans.use: to purchase computers and electronic health equipment

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah is 45 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the oldest communities in Liberia, that is well-known, and where there is lots of choice. Tawah is married and she stopped her education at elementary level since her parents did not put her in school. 

For the past nine years Tawah has been running a shop where she sells fashion clothes such as jean trousers, dresses, and  lappa (traditional cloth) slippers etc. She started this business by selling on a market table. With the little money that she received from this market-table business she managed to established her current business, and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

Tawah is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and has more customers because she sells quality products. She is requesting a loan to buy more fashion clothes such as jeans trousers, dresses, and  lappa (traditional cloth) slippers etc to increase her business. Tawah's plans are to build another shop and educate her children. She is kindly asking the lenders to be patient with them and keep lending them some money to improve theirs' and their children's lives.

loans.use: to buy more fashion clothes such as jean trousers, dresses, and lappa (traditional cloth) slippers etc to increase her business.

loans.name: Andonassoumana I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    ANDONASSOUMANA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme   ALIMATA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Andonassoumana I group are married women with an average age of 37 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Tola, one of the villages in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Alimata, standing on the left of the picture, grows corn. She plans to use her loan to pay the labourers and buy agricultural inputs and seeds needed for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 90 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour wages and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: Belén, de 56 años es una señora sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Máximo desde hace 30 años y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Belén se dedica a la agricultura, por está razón siembra maíz, papa alverja y quinua en 3 héctareas de su terreno de cultivo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora. Se dedica a varias actividades, pues su mayor sueño es brindar a sus hijos lo mejor. En las mañanas se dedica a la crianza de sus 6 vacas, para que le proporcionen una buena leche para que posteriormente venda este producto, además de dedicarse a la venta de productos agrícolas. En el futuro desea incursionar en la compra y venta de cerveza, para así obtener buenas ganancias, ya que es un producto de gran demanda. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Belén, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: 56-year-old Belen is an unassuming woman. She has been living with her husband Máximo for thirty years and she also lives with her two children in her own house. Belen makes a living from agriculture. She sows corn, potatoes, peas, and quinoa in three hectares of her cropland. She is a hard-working woman. She spends time doing various activities as her greatest dream is to give her children the best. In the mornings she spends time looking after her six cows so that they will give her good milk to sell. She also sells farming products. In the future she wants to get into buying and selling beer, thereby obtaining good profits as it is a product in high demand. This is her second loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead. She also promises to make her repayments on time. Belen will invest the 1500 PEN in purchasing organic compost to feed her seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida, de 32 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Zenaida se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de alverja, habas, olluco y papa en terrenos alquilados, pues no cuenta con unos propios, “mi objetivo es ahorrar todo el dinero necesario para comprar mis propios terrenos agrícolas”, comenta. Junto a su esposo trabajan en la producción de los terrenos, pues tiene que producir alimentos de calidad, para tener obtener buenos resultados durante todo el año. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Zenaida, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: 32-year-old Zenaida is a happy woman. She lives in a rented house with her husband and her three children. Zenaida makes a living from agriculture. Her sown fields contain peas, broad beans, ulluco, and potatoes. She grows them in rented plots as she does not own any land. She says: “my goal is to save the necessary money to buy my own farming land”. She and her husband work together on the land in order to obtain good results throughout the year as she has to produce high-quality crops. This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful to receive the financial support which will allow her to get ahead in life. She promises to make her repayments on time. Zenaida will invest the 1500 PEN in purchasing organic compost to feed her seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost

loans.name: Jean Bayard Roger

texts.fr: Jean Bayard est un homme de 51 ans,marié et père de 03 enfants. il est un informaticien maintenacier dans un quartier  de la place depuis 07ans. actuellement,son activité connait des difficultés liées aux manque de materiles.. c'est la raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock pour acheter le petit matériel de bureau et une imprimante. ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire la demande des clients et et de réaliser les bénéfices.lesquels l'aiderontà réaliser ses projets tels:agrandir sa structure et augmenter son niveau de stock. De même il aimerait satisfaire les besoins de sa famille en envoyant ses enfants à l'école.
texts.en: Jean Bayard is a 51-year-old man who is married and the father of 3 children. He has been working locally as a computer maintenance technician for 7 years. His business is currently suffering from difficulties due to a lack of supplies which is why he is requesting a loan which he will use to increase his stock of small office supplies and to buy a printer. This loan will enable him to satisfy his customer demand and to earn some profits which will help him to carry out his projects which include expanding his workspace and raising his inventory levels. He would also like to meet the needs of his family and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and a printer.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is the owner and operator of a home-based business that provides tax preparation and bookkeeping services for individuals. She has been in operation for 13 years and in this time, her portfolio has expanded to over 2000 clients. 

She provides services to the neighborhood of Jackson Heights in NYC, an area home to a large Hispanic community. Having grown up in the Dominican Republic, she is a native speaker of Spanish. This is crucial to Mercedes’ business since most of her clients are Spanish speaking and turn to her for trusted assistance. With his loan, Mercedes hopes to purchase office furniture so she can hire an assistant, and update her phone system. In the future, she also hopes to invest in marketing materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase office furniture and update the phone system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise shop items like soft drinks, sweets, biscuits and other items

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en: Emeliana is 56 years old and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian City. She is widowed with two children. She has a piggery business. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan to buy piglets. Emeliana has been a member for one year. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her livestock and poultry business.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her piggery business.

loans.name: Edwin Alexis

texts.es: Edwin, tiene 31 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Yoro, Yoro. Anteriormente el realizaba trabajos de albañilería y aprendió ebanistería en un taller. Hace  13 años pudo establecer su propio taller de ebanistería, donde hace puertas, ventanas, trabajos en tallado de madera, y cualquier tipo de  muebles. De este negocio logra cubrir sus gastos del hogar. El préstamo que solicito es el quinto ciclo con ODEF y es por 25,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar materia prima como madera, pinturas, lijas y otros para la fabricación de muebles como chineros, muebles de cocina, camas, cómodas etc.  Su objetivo es marcar la diferencia en el negocio y poder ayudar a su familia para que tengan mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Edwin is 31 years old and married. He has three children and lives in the municipality of Yoro, in Yoro. He previously did bricklaying work and learned carpentry in a workshop. Thirteen years ago he was able to establish his own carpentry workshop where he does woodcarving and makes doors, windows, and all types of furniture. By doing this work he manages to cover the household expenses. The loan he has requested is his fifth loan cycle with ODEF and it is for an amount of 25,000 HNL. He will use it to buy raw material, such as wood, paint, and sandpaper so he can make items of furniture, such as china cupboards, kitchen furniture, beds, and chests of drawers. His goal is to make his business stand out from other businesses and to be able to help his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as wood, paint, and sandpaper for making furniture

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Since he was 14 years old, Jeffrey has been around barbers. When his father passed away in his late teenage years, he was honored to take over the barber shop that formerly belonged to his father.  Jeffrey keeps the original sign on the store in his father’s name out of respect for his father and his clients who still come to the shop. Today, Jeffrey’s Barbershop & Salon employs a total of four people: two barbers and two hair stylist who specialize in eyebrows/waxing and braiding. 

When asked what his greatest opportunity he has had running the business is, Jeffrey proudly states, “having the honor of serving the same clients my dad did, their children, and now their grandchildren.”

This is Jeffrey’s second loan with Accion. According to his Loan Consultant, he is a great example of a client who takes technical assistance seriously in order to improve himself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his barber shop and purchase a new air conditioner

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is 40 years old and lives the Paynesville south area, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. Teta has four children between 3 to 15 years old. They all live at home and only three are in school. Unfortunately Teta's parents did not send her to school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a constructor who builds houses. 

For the past 16 years Teta has been selling dry and fresh fish in the local market; now she faces no problems. She sells for six days a week from 7AM to 5PM on her business. Teta started this business with a little income that she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry and fresh fish for her business. Teta hopes to build her house. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more dry and fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 55 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Aida is engaged in peanut butter and salted pry “uyap” processing and vending activity. She earns approximately PHP 2,720 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional nuts for peanut butter processing and pry for her existing business. Aida became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Aida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional nuts for peanut butter processing and pry

loans.name: Andonassoumana Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    ANDONASSOUMANA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme FATOUMATA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Andonassoumana II group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Tola, one of the villages in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Fatoumata, standing on the left of the picture, grows corn. She plans to use her loan to pay the labourers and buy seeds and fertilizer needed for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 105 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour wages and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en:
This is Weedor from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb in the capital city of Monrovia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Weedor is 35, and married with two children. Her children's ages are 18 and 7. They are currently living at home and they are in school.  
Weedor owns a shop, where she has sold rubber dishes such as plates, buckets, etc, and fashion clothes such as jean trousers, tee-shirts etc, for the past four years. Weedor will use the loan proceeds to purchase more of all these items for her business.  

On average, Weedor works from 7am to 8pm at her business. She started her business with help from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi. Weedor cites less stock as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the flow of customers. In the future, Weedor would like to build a modern house.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes such as plates, buckets, etc and fashion clothes such as jean trousers, tee-shirts etc for her business

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 21 years old, single, and loves to help her parents, especially in terms of their finances. 

She is asking a loan that will be used to start up a hog-raising business. The loan of PHP 5,000 will be used to buy one sack of feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business. After three months, she can then sell them on to buyers. 

Maha dreams that someday she can raise 20 heads of pigs. In her free time, she love to watch television and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy one sack of feed and vitamins for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is selling various grocery items like biscuits, junk food and spices in her village. Sometimes, she also sells milk and fish for additional profit. She has been in this business for 15 years, while her husband operates their transport service. The couple are also into farming, where income generated from this is seasonal. 

Myrna's eldest child has successfully finished the tertiary level of education, due to their hard work in their business. She wishes the same for her youngest child - that she will also finish college. Myrna keeps on managing her retailing business to provide for her childrens' needs, especially her youngest one. It would be helpful for her to gain higher income if she is able to expand the products that she sells. Therefore, she is borrowing the amount of PHP 35,000 to buy meat, fruit and grocery items to sell.

loans.use: to buy meat, fruit and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married with five children. She is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. Susan is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to be used as additional capital for her flower garden. Susan has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Susan hopes to expand her flower garden into a flower plantation.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for her flower garden.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Felicidad has a hog-raising business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy feed for her pigs and use it as additional capital for her business.

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to have a piggery farm and have her own meat store.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital and to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Pagadian - San Jose District, Pagadian City

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Originally from Peru, Juan has been living in the United States for 26 years. He currently lives with his fiancé and daughter. Driven by his passion for music, Juan decided to open his own business after nearly 18 years of experience with pro audio equipment both in the music industry and in retail/sales as an authorized dealer. 

Juan’s storefront business, Rock Audio Inc, has been in operation since 2007. He sells music equipment online, including head phones, speakers, DJ Controllers, mixers, turntables, DJ bundles or accessories. The sales are done via his website and Ebay.

To learn more, visit his website at http://www.rookaudio.com and his Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Rook-Audio/148383121889377.

loans.use: to upgrade his website and purchase new equipment

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Mr. Gantumur is 35 years old and lives with his brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling dumplings since last year. He hires six workers and together they produce 100 kilograms of dumplings per day. In the summer, the orders for dumplings by retailers increases drastically, so he wants to increase output by 50 more kilograms. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an additional fridge and raw materials such as meat and flour. He delivers the orders of retailers by using his truck that accommodates fridges and dumplings. Before this dumpling business, he had been growing vegetables in countryside, and in the autumn he sold his harvest to vendors at market. His brother graduated this year and is currently seeking a job related to the human resources field. The borrower is a very hardworking person who has taken care of his brother.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and raw materials such as meat and flour for his dumpling-making business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia grew up in Mexico and dreamt of owning a business and home. She immigrated to San Diego 16 years ago, and before starting Paradiso Fruit, she worked for a local Panaderia, or Mexican bakery. The popular bakery was known both for its empanadas and the variety of healthier options, including gluten-free goods. 

This mother of six children is no stranger to hard work.  Leticia helped scrub and clean at the popular bakery. While taking out the trash one day, she walked by another storefront and noticed that it was empty. “The shop looked trashed, the walls were collapsing,” Leticia shared. As she looked at the empty storefront, she felt inspired to create healthy food alternatives for her family and community.  Back at home, her family enjoyed the baked treats that their mother helped create, but Leticia noticed a growing problem. “I was watching my kids get fatter and fatter,” she exclaimed. 

Setting up the new store was no small feat and was a community effort from the beginning. Leticia’s church jumped in to help. A church member created the beautiful murals that customers can now enjoy in the store. Another scraped and painted the store. Her son and another friend dragged junk from the store and reconstructed it.

Leticia’s Kiva loan will help her purchase her initial inventory of healthy food. Customers can enjoy fruit salads, sandwiches and more nutritious meal options. Business is already growing.  She shares, “Before this it was just Taqueria after Taqueria! People come in and thank me for the healthy options.” 

 The current menu has been a success and Leticia will stick with what she knows. “People are looking for ways to be healthier,” she says. She plans to grow the new business, then open new stores and create more jobs for the community.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables and other healthy foods to cook and sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 29 years old, and is married with three children. She has a small store within their house, where she sells canned goods, noodles, spices, vinegars and cooking oil. Working in the store has helped her family earn a consistent income. 

Now, Florence is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, bath soap, soy sauce, salt and soft drinks so that she can bring in more products as well as to have greater income.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, bath soap, soy sauce, salt and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. 

Her husband provides shuttering services to his customers. He provides shuttering material such as bamboos for pillars, iron sheets, wooden boards etc, for using in the construction of buildings. In his last contract, most of the bamboo and wooden boards have broken, which is creating trouble for providing shuttering services.

Shazia is worried about her husband's business because it is the single source of income for her family, and her whole family fully depends upon her husband.

Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy new shuttering material. Shazia was very happy and relaxed after taking this loan, because this loan will help establish the business and their savings as well.

Note: Shazia has raised her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to buy shuttering material for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila wishes to expand the physical site of her business stall because her store inventory has increased. She is 44 years old, married and has three children. She started her business by purely selling snack foods, bread, and some spices. While managing her small store, Nila realized that her income is just enough for their food, and so she arrived to the thought that she needed to have extra income to cope with her children's schooling. 

Whenever her earnings get higher, she saves some of it until she was able to buy a coconut and rice grinder machine to make additional business income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy canned goods and stocks of beverages to sell in her store. She will also use the loan for the maintenance of her coconut and rice grinder machine. Through profits gained from business, she is able to send her children to school and one of them already finished college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and stocks of beverages to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with six children. She is 57 years old and lives in Lantian, labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. Delia sells rice cakes and other native snacks to earn a living; she has had this business for almost three years. She has requested a loan to be used as additional capital for her business.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Delia hopes to have her own trademark on the foods she makes and deliver it into different grocery stores around the city.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for her food stall business.

location.town: Pagadian Lantian, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joevilito

texts.en:
Joevilito is a 32 year old married man with two children. He lives in Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental with his family. His wife is a businesswoman, while he farms to earn a living. 

Joevilito plants and harvests bananas, and sells them in the market. The bulk of his bananas will be sold to contract buyers in their community. He has been doing this for five years and has been able to support the basic needs of his family. 

He planned to cultivate the farm so that he can harvest more bananas in return, so he borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. He hopes to generate an abundant harvest to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure, to cultivate his bananas.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 49 years old, and is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. For some time, his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of which, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Bushra as a member of a two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Bushra is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Kenny

texts.en:
Kenny was born and raised in the United States to parents of Colombian descent. He lives with his wife and daughter. 

He has owned “Davie Feed and Ranch Supplies LLC” for nearly two years now. His business is a retail store that offers high-quality hay, farm tools, lawn supplies, and gifts. He also sells animal feed and supplies. Part of the reason Kenny loves owning a small business is the one-on-one contact he gets with customers. “I love working with people and love to see my client happy with what I offer”, says Kenny. 

Recently, he has increased his business hours by opening on Sundays while his competitors are closed. He has also been running a publicity campaign to attract new clientele. He is most excited about his upcoming Saturday events which include free BBQ, a mechanical bull, and an all-day shopping pass which gives customers a 10% discount. 
 
In the future, Kenny hopes to expand his business to cover the Northern part of Broward County, Parkland. Eventually, he also wants to purchase the land he works on to maximize his profits by renting a part of the land to other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a second fork lift

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en: Mrs. Tserendolgor is 60 years old and lives with her husband in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She began running a detoxification center in April 2013. Her husband is a driver and salesman at a private business entity. All of their five children live separately from them. Her detoxification center is running well and in just four months, the number of customers has increased drastically. So, she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase additional equipment and detoxification products. The local people, especially women, are grateful to her because there are many unemployed youngsters who are addicted to alcohol. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase detoxification products and equipment.

loans.name: Xenia Sulay

texts.es:
La señora Xenia vive en una colonia de Danli, en la zona oriente del país junto a su familia,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas, como ser bikinis, bóxer, braseares etc. ella vende en su casa y de manera ambulante.
Doña Xenia su negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, siendo sus principales clientes sus vecinos y personas de colonias cercanas, es una persona muy dinámica, alegre y amable  cualidades que son necesarias en el desempeño de su trabajo y sobretodo en la atención  que le da a sus clientes por esta razón la prefieren.
Doña Xenia  está solicitando el crédito para  compra al  por mayor bikinis, bóxer, braseares, etc.  y así obtener mejores precios lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ganancias ya que tiene bastante mercadería encargada, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, 


 
Danlí, Honduras  - Julio 2013
texts.en:
Xenia lives with her family in the residential area of Danli in the eastern part of the country.  She sells women's underwear such as bikinis, boxers, bras, etc. and works from home and as a street vendor.

Xenia has been in business for four years and her main customers are neighbors and people in nearby communities.  She is a very dynamic, cheerful, kind person; and these are attributes necessary for her job, especially regarding good customer service which keeps them loyal.

The loan being requested by Xenia is to buy wholesale bikinis, boxers, bras, etc. so she can earn more profit on the orders she has already received.  Her family is supportive of her.


Danlí, Honduras - July 2013

loans.use: To buy panties, bikinis, boxers, bras, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio tiene 36 años, casado con tres hijos, el se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva, el se dedica a esta actividad hace ya muchos años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona Carpenter, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Lucio utilizara este préstamo para compra de maquina recta y over para la confección de sus prendas de vestir, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, El Sr. Lucio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir El Sr. Lucio se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lucio is 36 years old and married with three children. He makes a living by making sports clothes. He has been doing this for many years. His workshop is located in the area of Carpenter. This loan is his first loan cycle with this institution. Lucio will use this loan to purchase an overlock machine to make articles of clothing. His reason for requesting this loan is his lack of working capital. Lucio faces challenges in his business, such as continuing to improve the quality of the garments he makes. He is going to use the loan to continue increasing his working capital. He wants his business to grow and he wants to make a variety of clothing. Lucio feels happy and he is grateful for the support the institution is giving him.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 38 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Julio con quien tiene 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 13 años. Desde las primeras horas del día se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas comenta que gracias a su buenos ingresos pudo comprar más terrenos donde siembra papa y maíz en gran cantidad, pues su pueblo queda al borde del río y eso le ayuda a mejorar sus sembríos y a tener cosechas de calidad, además del trasporte pues se ubican en plena carretera central. Ahora su proyecto es incursionar en la crianza de animales, comenta que ya cuenta con vacas y cerdos los cuales comercializa tras cualquier apuro económico. Ahora desea mejorar sus sembríos para poder obtener más ingresos y así invertir más dinero en la ganadería. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Victoria, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: 38-year-old Victoria is an unassuming woman. She lives with her husband Julio, with whom she has four children. They live in the house they bought thirteen years ago. From the early hours of the day she spends time tending to her plots of land. She says that thanks to her good income she has been able to buy more plots of land, where she sows large amounts of potatoes and corn. Her village is at the edge of the river and this helps her to improve her sown fields and to have high-quality harvests. Transportation is also easy for her because they are near the central motorway. Now her project is to get into raising animals. She says that she already has some cows and pigs, which she sells when she encounters any economic difficulties. Now she wants to improve her crops in order to obtain greater revenue and be able to invest more in farming. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the economic support she is receiving to get ahead in life. She promises to make her repayments on time. Victoria will invest the 1000 PEN in purchasing organic compost to feed her seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold's business started with a small repair shop 20 years ago, and has now became a machine and fabrication shop. He is 46 years old, married to Yvone and blessed with three children. He manages their machine shop and offers services to their valued customers. Arnold's children are all attending school.

Together with his wife, they dream that their present business becomes a big farm machine manufacturer someday. Slowly, Arnold will come to attain this. For now, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy tools and machines to help them improve their services to their customers. He is very optimistic that his dream will come true in due time.

loans.use: to buy tools and machines to help them improve their services to their customers.

loans.name: Maria Susan

texts.en: Maria Susan is 33 years old and lives in Dao Pagadian City. She is married with three children. She has a sari sari store that sells goods and dry goods and earns approximately PHP 9,000 each month doing this business. She requested a loan to buy more products to sell. Maria Susan has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy goods and dry goods for her general  store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 55 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with four children. She earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month from her hog fattening business. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase sacks of feed for her existing hog fattening business. 

Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed for her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Ma. Anna Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Anna is 42 years old and lives in Tacdog, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines. She is separated, and has three children who are all school-aged. 

She has been engaged in a boarding house activity for almost six months. She had requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to be used to purchase additional cement, gravel, sand and wood to expand her boarding house. 

Ma. Anna is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ma. Anna hopes to improve her life with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional cement, gravel, sand and wood to expand her boarding house.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 34 years old, and is married with five children. She lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

She operates her own sari-sari store to earn a living, and she has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. Perlita has requested a loan for PHP 30,000 for additional capital.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her her business.

loans.use: with additional capital, to enable her to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nora Indalecia

texts.es:
La Señora Nora vive en una colonia de Danli, en el oriente de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus hijos,  ella tiene un puesto de ropa de segunda en su casa de habitación, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería de varias casas,  también vende comida los fines de semana.
Doña Nora vende sopas y elabora golosinas como ser nacatamales entre otras siendo esta su fuente principal de ingresos desde hace 5 años, la ubicación estratégica del negocio le permite captar gran cantidad de clientes  y su negocio lo mantiene surtido siendo esta una de las características que sobresalen en la ella.
Doña Nora es  amable y les da a sus clientes calidad de atención por esta razón la prefieren,  nos está solicitando el crédito para comprar pantalones, vestidos, faldas, blusas y pollo, maíz, verduras que son los insumos  necesarios para la elaboración de golosinas y alimentos. 
Doña Nora uno de los objetivos que tiene es comprar fardos tipo Premium que traen ropa clasificada de mejor calidad,  ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. 


 
Danlí, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Nora lives in the small city of Danli, eastern Honduras, with her husband and children. She has a secondhand clothes stall which she runs from her home, and also sells cosmetics and perfumes in her neighborhood. In addition, Nora offers food for sale on the weekends.

Nora sells ​​soups and snacks such as nacatamales, among other delicacies. This has been her main source of income for the past five years, and the strategic location of her business allows her to attract a large number of customers. Another factor which contributes to her success is the variety of products she is able to offer. 

She is a friendly lady who gives a high quality of service to her customers, which is why she is popular with them. She is applying for this loan to buy pants, dresses, skirts, and blouses, as well as chicken, corn and vegetables which are the ingredients needed for the preparation of her snacks and meals.

One of Nora's goals is to buy bales of Premium clothes, which are rated as being of high quality. She has the support of her husband.
 
Danlí, Honduras - July 2013

loans.use: to purchase pants, dresses, skirts and blouses, as well as chicken, corn and vegetables for her businesses

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en: Edmar is from San Carlos, Tukuran. He is 43 years old. Edmar is married and has two children. To make a living, he manages and operates a general store together with his wife. Edmar has been engaged in his business for years and earns 15,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Edmar joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 55,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice, feed, and canned goods. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, feed, and canned goods for his general store.

loans.name: Victalina

texts.es:
Victalina es una joven de 22 años de edad con muchas fuerzas, muchos deseos, sueños y esperanzas de ser mejor cada día que pasa y que DIOS le regala de vida. Ella tiene 3 años de educación primaria y es madre de 3 hijos y en su compañía también vive su madre la cual le ayuda con las actividades en la casa en su ausencia. Ella ayuda a su pareja en la venta de granos básicos como ser maíz, frijol, arroz y café. Ella tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad y el terreno que cultivan es propio el cual está ubicado a 10 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada en bus.   

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, foliares, urea, formula cafetalera, etc. para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. 

Sus planes son extender más sus cultivos de café los cuales le generaran ingresos para el desarrollo de su familia, negocio y para poder preparar a sus hijos mandándolos a la universidad y que aprovechen los estudios para que el día de mañana se les abran puertas y puedan desempeñarse muy bien en sus negocios, trabajo, etc.
texts.en:
Victalina, 22, is a young woman with a lot of courage, desires, dreams and hopes to become better every day with God's blessing.  She received a third grade education and is the mother of three children.  She also lives with her mother who helps out with household activities in her absence.  Victalina helps her partner sell basic grains such as corn, beans, rice and coffee.  For three years she has been in this business, and the land she cultivates is her own.  It is located ten kilometers from home and she travels there by bus.

Victalina is requesting a loan through COMIXMUL to buy supplies such as fertilizer, leaf treatment, urea, coffee formula, etc. to care for and maintain her coffee crop.

Her plans are to expand her coffee plantation to increase her income for the development of her family and business, and to prepare her children for the university.  She wants them to take advantage of their studies so that in the future the doors will be open to them to find a good job or go into business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Angela has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Amalina

texts.en:
Amalina is 53 years old, married and has six children. Her husband is operating a motor vehicle used to provide transportation services to passengers. Amalina runs a simple general store business in their village. She admits that her income from the business is not enough in sustaining their needs. Sometimes, to cover their household expenses, she asks for financial assistance from her daughter who is working abroad.

She does not want to rely on assistance from her daughter's financial support forever. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional stocks of goods such as canned goods, powder milk, drinks, and bread to sell in their village to increase her daily sales. She hopes to expand the business and gain enough income to sustain their household needs and will no longer ask for her daughter's support.

loans.use: to buy additional goods such as canned goods, powder milk, drinks, and bread to sell in their village.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
