texts.en: Iman was born in 1968. She is married and has 4 sons. She lives in Amman, Jordan. Iman has been raising birds and selling them since 6 years ago. She found this project profitable, and it is close to a hobby to her. She was facing some obstacles raising birds especially during the winter. Iman is planning to raise her income. So, she is asking for a loan to buy a larger number of birds of different types, which will help her to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy new types of birds to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1978. He lives in Zarqaa, Jordan. Mohammad is married and has 5 children. He is working in selling scrap, and his wife has been working in selling foodstuffs at her own mini market since 4 years ago, an endeavor which they found to be profitable. She started her project by selling foodstuffs at their house, and now they are selling them at their own mini-market, but it’s not licensed yet. They are planning to expand their project by raising the amount of their merchandise and to license their mini market in the future. Now Mohammad is requesting a loan to help his wife buy more foodstuffs in order to raise their sales and income.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs in order to raise his sales

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 20 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan, with his family, which consists of six family members. Mohammad is currently studying for a Bachelor of Finance and Management Science degree, in his second year. One of the obstacles that Mohammad is now facing is not having enough money to pay for his study fees. He is planning to graduate with an excellent grade average and to work in his field of study after graduation. Now he is asking for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Doña Adela tiene 48 años de edad, es casada es ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 2 hijos los cuales son adultos y uno de ellos vive en EE.UU. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleto el cual no pudo continuar cursando por la falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos. En compañía de su esposo y su hijo trabajan la siembra y elaboración de viveros de café como también la siembra de maíz y frijol. Como desafió ella encuentra la varianza de los precios en cuanto a este producto como también los insumos agrícolas que necesita para el mantenimiento  de este producto. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 10 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie en compañía de su hijo y su esposo.

Actualmente ella planea sacar una excelente cosecha de café pero para ser posible eso ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara los insumos agrícolas necesarios para proteger sus cultivos de enfermedades y bichos. 

Sus planes a futuro son los de ver sus cultivos en las mejores condiciones posibles hacer que su producto sea atractivo para los clientes finales y generar ganancias para re invertir y construir un patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos.
texts.en:
Adela, 48, is married and the mother of two adult children, one of whom lives in the United States.  She's a homemaker and a farmer.  She wasn't able to continue her elementary education because her parents had limited economic resources and couldn't help her.

She, her husband, and her children do the planting and take care of the coffee plants as well as grow corn and beans.  Her challenge is the change in coffee prices and the agricultural inputs she needs to maintain the crops.  Her crops are a 10-minute walk from her house; she walks there with her son and her husband.

Currently she plans to get an excellent coffee harvest, but to make that possible she's requesting a loan from COMIXMUL cooperative to buy the necessary agricultural inputs to protect her plants from disease and pests.

Her plans for the future are to see her plants in better condition, to make her crop more attractive for the final customers, and to generate profits to re-invest and build her assets for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 30-year-old married woman. She is actively involved in a business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  

Khadija is a dedicated mother of two. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase another calf. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Naheeda

texts.en: Naheeda is a 21-year-old married woman. She started stitching clothes a year ago because the income of her husband is not enough to meet all of the household expenses. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her to stitch more dresses on time. She wishes to spend part of her income to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Francisca Mariela

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Guasmo.  Desde siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer emprendedora, que le gusta el comercio en general.  Empezó tiempo atrás vendiendo legumbres para luego vender pollo también.  Trabaja sola todos los días de 8 am a 3 pm.  Es soltera y desea llegar a tener una despensa y bazar grandes.  Necesita el crédito para comprar pollos, mesas y sacrificadores para su despensa.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the sector of Guasmo. She has always been known as an enterprising woman who enjoys the retail trade. Some time ago, she started selling legumes and later began selling chickens as well. The borrower works alone every day from 8:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. She is single and wants to have a large food store and bazaar.

The borrower needs a loan so that she can buy chickens, tables, and meat processing equipment for her food shop.

loans.use: to buy chickens, tables, and meat processing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions, peppers, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ifat

texts.en:
Ifat is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing of services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Ifat is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 40,000. She will use the loan to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. With the help of the loan, she will be able to cater to more customers time after time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 22 years old. He lives in Madaba, Jordan, with his family, which consists of four family members. He is currently studying for his Bachelor of Psychological Counseling degree, in his second year at Mutah University. Mohammad is planning to work in his field of study in the future, but he is facing financial problems, which is stopping him from being able to pay for his study fees. He is now asking for a loan to pay for the fees for this semester.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with four children: one son and three daughters. Husam works as an employee in the public sector, and this is the only source of income for the family. Husam is a known client for FATEN because he took some loans before this one.

Husam has taken a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a filter for water purification for the family home. By applying this loan, Husam will be able to provide pure water for his children, especially since the water there is not pure. 

Husam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a filter for water purification for the family home.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu appreciates Kiva for the loan she was given that enabled her to earn more profits, which she used for her family's income.

She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase maize flour, sugar and salt for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support that helps her grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar and salt for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad. 
Doña Rosa necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, cal, leña. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto. Ella espera gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten.
Doña Rosa espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Ms Rosa is a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives along side her children and husband in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business of selling and making tortillas is well-known in her community.  Ms Rosa needs the loan to buy corn, lime powder and firewood, which are necessary to continue making her product.

Thanks to the loan she hopes to have the necessary products to continue carrying out her business. She also hopes to cover the demand of her clients and at the same time, increase her business's sales.  Ms Rosa hopes that her business continues growing and becomes the most well-known of the community.  This way, she can continue supporting her family and her children can continue with school and have better opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder for her business

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael was born in 1962. He is married and lives in Irbid, Jordan, with his four children. His wife is an employee in the public sector. Wael is retired from the military. Wael is facing some financial problems that are keeping him from being able to pay for his youngest daughter's study fees. For security reasons, he let his daughter take his place in the picture. Now Wael is seeking a loan to be able to pay for his daughter's study fees and help her reach her goal, which is to work in her field of study after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for the study fees of his daughter (pictured).

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La cliente vive en Machala.  Empezó su negocio a raíz de la muerte de su esposo, luego emprendió en su juguería en el centro de la ciudad y ahora mantiene el negocio en su casa propia.  Trabaja todos los días cn su ayudante.  Es viuda y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela y colegio fiscales.  Desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de bebidas hidratantes, colas, agua y frutas.
texts.en: Marisol lives in Machala.  She started in business following the death of her husband.  Later, she opened up a juice bar in the center of the city, and now she has the business in her own home.  She works every day with her assistant.  Marisol is a widow with 3 children who attend the public schools.  She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of sports drinks, colas, water, and fruit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (colas, water, sports drinks, and fruit)

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Prosperidad y Amistad” constituida por  05 socios responsables y trabajadores, que buscan mejorar a través de sus negocios. Este es el caso de nuestra socia Maurelia hace 04 años que cuenta con una librería bazar en su vivienda, comenzó con la venta de golosinas, poco a poco puedo implementar su negocio. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo a logrado apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y comprarse su propio stand donde ofrece sus productos. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de útiles escolares como cuadernos, fólderes, temperas y papel. Maurelia de 51 años,  es casada y tiene 06 hijos, 02 de ellos en etapa escolar. El grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.  Maurilia es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco, casaca rosada y pantalón rojo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Prosperidad Y Amistad" is made up of 5 responsible and hardworking members who are seeking to improve their lives through their businesses.  This is the case with Maurelia, who has had a stationery store in her home for 4 years.  She started out selling sweets, and gradually set up her business.  With the fruits of her efforts she has managed to support the education of her children and buy her own stand where she offers her products for sale.  Her main desire is to continue to invest in her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy school supplies such as: notebooks, folders, paints and paper.  Maurelia is 51 years old, married, and has 6 children, 2 of whom are school-aged.  

The group "Prosperidad Y Amistad" is grateful to the people who are making this loan possible.  Maurelia is the first from the left, wearing the white shirt, pink jacket, and red pants.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, folders, paints and paper

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos  y vive  en una aldea del municipio de el Negrito, Yoro. Ella tiene 16 años de tener la venta de comidas típicas y golosinas como baleadas, pastelitos rellenos con carne y merienda a un jardín de niños.  Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos de donde cubre sus gastos. Ha solicitado el sexto ciclo de préstamo con ODEF y es por 6,000 lempiras,  el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos como harinas, carnes, condimentos, manteca, y otros para la elaboración de comidas y una parte para la reparación de una estufa. Su objetivo es que su negocio siga creciendo y generando ingresos, también que su hijo culmine los estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro. For 16 years she has been selling typical foods, sweets like baleadas, pastries filled with meat, and snacks to a kindergarten. This job is their source of income and it covers their expenses. 

She has requested a sixth loan with ODEF for 6,000 lempiras. She will invest it in the purchase of products such as flours, meats, condiments, and butter, for the preparation of meals. She will also use a portion to repair a stove. 

Her goal is that her business continues growing and generating income, and also that her son finishes his schooling.

loans.use: to buy products such as flours, meats, condiments, and butter, for the preparation of meals, and to repair a stove.

loans.name: Denis Omar

texts.es:
El  señor Denis es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la compra y venta de Huevos, desde hace 5 años.
Don Denis distribuye su producto en los diferentes barrios y colonias de localidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra demás  huevos los cuales necesita para cubrir la demanda que tiene de sus clientes. 
Don Denis espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que contara con el producto suficiente con el cual podrá satisfacer los pedidos y demandas de sus  clientes así mismo espera que sus ventas aumenten y así mejorar  un poco su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
Don Denis su sueño es que en unos años su negocio sea el más reconocido de la comunidad para así poder seguir apoyando a su familia en las metas y sueños y que su hijo continúe con los estudios para que tenga mayor numero de oportunidades en el futuro.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Denis is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives with his wife and child in a community in southern Honduras.  He's had a business selling eggs for 5 years.

Denis distributes his products in the various neighborhoods and districts of his town.  He is requesting a loan to buy more eggs, because he needs more products to meet the demand of his customers.

Denis expects that this loan will very useful, because it will enable him to have enough products to fill his orders and satisfy his customers' demand.  Also, he expects that his sales will grow, allowing him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Denis' dream is that in a few years his business will be the most well-known business in the community, so that he can continue to support his family in their goals and keep his son in school so that he'll have more opportunities in the future.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy eggs for his business

loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es: La Sra. Cintia, tiene 26  años de edad, es soltera  y tiene 3 hijos.la Sra.  Cintia, se dedica desde hace 5 años  a la venta de calzados, (sandalias, zapatos etc.) la Sra. Cintia ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas.la Sra.  Cintia usará el préstamo para poder comprar más productos de calzados,  a la vez la Sra. Cintia  y todos los integrantes se encuentran agradecidos con Kiva por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Cintia se encuentra parada  se encuentra detrás de la mesa  Se despide Dejando la promesa que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Cintia is 26 years old, single, and has 3 children. For 5 years now she has sold shoes (sandals, shoes, etc.) Cintia has established a loyal customer base which has generated earnings enabling her to cover household expenses.

In the future, Cintia would like to open a shop where she can sell her merchandise and obtain greater earnings. She will use her loan to purchase added footwear.

Cintia and all the other group members are grateful to Kiva for facilitating this loan and for the confidence they have demonstrated in them. 

Cintia appears in the photo seated behind the table. She bids goodbye, offering the promise that she will comply with all her proposed targets.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 28-year-old married man from Qalqilia. He lives in a humble house with his wife and three sons. 

Moath is a worker with a low income which is not enough to cover the family needs, so he opened a small coffee shop in the city three years ago. It is a good business and earns enough money for his family, but Moath would like to improve it by expanding the space and buying more tables and chairs. 

Moath took a USD loan from FATEN to accomplish the improvements. Using this loan, Moath will be able to develop his business so his income will be increased. 

Moath appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand the café space, and buy more tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cucumbers, olives, and eggplants to make more pickles

loans.name: Help We Self Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Magburaka town 48 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary schools. 

For seven years now, Mohamed has been selling onions, margi (a stew/soup seasoning), peppers, tomatoes, rice, etc.

With the help of this loan, these entreprenuers will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand his business; he will buy onions, margi, peppers, tomatoes, rice, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi, peppers, tomatoes, rice, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 32 years old, and from Nyahururu. She is married to John, who is a farmer, and together they have one child. 

She owns a hair and beauty salon and she has been in this business for the past eleven years. Purity has applied for her third loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET Ltd, and her plan is to use it for buying hair weaves, braids, and chemicals for her salon.

Purity earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000, and her hope and desire for the future is to start a beauty college in her area.

loans.use: To buy weaves, braids, and chemicals for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates the loan she was given by Kiva that enabled her to purchase more Khanga clothes that helped her get more profit and thus paid school fees for her child.

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more bundles of Khanga clothes to sell. She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of Khanga clothes to sell

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa was born in 1969. She is married and has six children. Wafaa got experience from working at a beauty salon in the past. Then she opened her own beauty salon at her house. One of the obstacles that she faced is the lack of space. Wafaa found her project profitable, and she is planning to expand it in the future. Now she is seeking a loan to buy a steam machine that her customers are requesting, which will bring her more new customers and make her salon special.

loans.use: To buy a steam machine

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 34-year-old man from Olkalou. He is married to Beatrice, who is a teacher, and together they are blessed with one child, who is 3.

Duncan operates a green grocery shop and also sells charcoal, a business he has been in for the past two years. He has applied for his fifth loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET Ltd, and he plans to use it to buy more stock for his green grocery, and also to buy charcoal.

In the future, Duncan hopes that he will become successful, probably a millionaire, and be able to raise assets for his family's security.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and to add stock to his green grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 52 years old and married to Grace; and they are blessed with two children, ages 23 and 20. He buys and sells green tea leaves in  the Chepkongony location in Kaptumo. David has been in this business for the past four years, and he gets a monthly income of KES. 25,200.

He is served by KADET's Kapsabet branch. 

David has borrowed a loan of KES. 60,000, which he will use to purchase more green tea leaves to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to pay his loan, pay college fees for his children, and the remaining amount to sustain his family.

David's dream is to build his family a permanent house, and to expand his business into a more profitable one.

loans.use: To purchase un-processed tea leaves

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam was born in 1955. She is married and has three children. 

She and her husband own a mini market, and Mariam has been working with her husband selling foodstuff for four years. She started this project with buying foodstuffs and chips, and selling them to her neighbors. Then she expanded this project by opening their mini market. 

Now she is seeking a loan to change the decoration of her mini market, and buying more foodstuffs to raise their sales to earn a better income to cover all of their children's needs.

loans.use: To change the decoration of her mini market and buying more foodstuffs

loans.name: Mirna Yecenia

texts.es: Mirna, tiene 31 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Su actividad económica que le genera ingresos para su familia, es una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijoles, lácteos, embutidos, harina de trigo y de maíz, huevos, sal, pan, refrescos y productos de higiene). Ella ha tenido la oportunidad de invertir tres préstamos los que le han ayudado a mantener activo el negocio. Actualmente ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de  préstamo de L.15,000.00, el que invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios, como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, churros, pan, verduras etc. para surtir la pulpería. Su meta es ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, aumentar su negocio y ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna is 31 years old, she is married and has 3 children. She lives in a community of the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality. 

The economic activity that generates an income for her family is a small grocery store where she sells staple goods (rice, beans, milk products, lunch meats, wheat and corn flours, eggs, salt, bread, drinks and personal hygiene products). She has had the chance to invest in three loans which have helped her to keep her business active. 

Currently she is applying for the fourth cycle of a L.15,000.00 loan, which she will invest in the purchase of edible goods such as basic grains, sugar, lard, drinks, churros, bread, vegetables, etc. in order to stock her grocery store. Her goal is to offer a greater variety of products to her clients, increase her business and help with the studies on her children.

loans.use: to purchase edible goods such as basic grains, sugar, lard, drinks, churros, bread, vegetables, etc. in order to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija was born in 1971. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker, and has a scrap shop. 

Khadija has been selling clothes and make up for three years. She started her project at home by selling clothes to her neighbors. She expanded her business by increasing her customers. At first, she faced an obstacle in marketing her products, but now she has a good number of customers. 

Khadija is planning to add more products to sell. She is requesting a loan to buy housewares and bed sheets to sell in order to earn a better income to cover her children's needs.

loans.use: To buy housewares and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es de la zona de Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás con la venta de camarones, para luego montar una pequeña tienda con la que trabaja hasta la actualidad.  Adicionalmente, se dedica a prestar servicios de taxi ejecutivo.  Ambas actividades las realiza el solo, de 6 am a 10 pm.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Desea invertir el dinero en la compra de productos no perecibles para comercializarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the District of Isla Trinitaria in Guayaquil. Some time ago, he started selling shrimp but later opened a small store where he now works. In addition, he provides executive taxi services. He manages both businesses by himself from 6:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. The borrower is single and has no children.

He wants to invest the money in the purchase of nonperishable products to sell in his business.

loans.use: to buy nonperishable products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, es una mujer luchadora de 38 años, que vive en compañía de su esposo Hector y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Norma tiene una tienda de comestibles, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, dulces, frutas, y demás necesidades de sus vecinos. Paralelamente a su negocio, ella también se dedica a la agricultura, donde siembra en 3 hectáreas de terreno agrícolas, el cual alquiló por un periodo de 5 años, ahí tiene una variedad de frutas como: plátanos, palta  y café. Tiene como meta progresar y ampliar su tienda, convirtiéndola en la más surtida de su localidad. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Norma, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de productos comestibles para su tienda, tales como arroz, leche, harina, conservas de pescado, entre otros.
texts.en:
Norma, age 38, is a determined woman who lives in her own home with her husband Hector and their three children. She has a food store where she sells basic necessities, sweets, fruits, and other products to her neighbors. In addition to her business, Norma is a farmer who has three hectares of farmland that she is renting over a five-year period. She grows a variety of crops such as bananas, avocados, and coffee. Norma’s goals are to make progress and convert her store into the most highly-stocked business in her town.

This is her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she has received. In addition, she promises to submit her loan payments in a punctual manner. Norma will invest her loan of 2,500 PEN in the purchase of food products for her store such as rice, milk, flour, canned fish, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, flour, canned fish, and other products.

loans.name: Noemy Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Noemí de 55 años de edad es soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, posee casa propia ubicad en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, doña Noemí se dedica desde hace varios años  al negocio de elaboración y venta de golosinas como: tacos, enchiladas, almuerzos, cenas, refrescos y más.
Doña Noemí sus clientes le prefieren por su calidad y buena atención en su negocio es una mujer emprendedora y con deseo de salir adelante.
Doña Noemí el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de carnes, papas, repollos, tomates, queso, aguas, refrescos, mantequilla, plátanos, frijoles, arroz, etc. y también para construir un tramo de calle al frente de su casa y brindar a sus clientes mas comodidad en su local. 
Doña Noemí su sueño es que sus hijas terminen la universidad y tengan un empleo.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en: Noemí is 55 years old, single and has two children who depend on her. She has her own home in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. Noemí has made a living for a number of years making and selling tacos, enchiladas, lunches, dinners, soft drinks and other items. Her customers prefer her thanks to the quality of her food and her good customer service. Noemí is an enterprising woman with a desire to make headway. She is requesting the loan to purchase meats, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, cheese, water, soft drinks, butter, bananas, beans, rice and other items, as well as to build a pathway from the street to the front of her home and to provide her customers with more comfort in her restaurant. Noemí's dream is for her children to graduate from college and have jobs.

loans.use: to purchase meats, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, cheese, water, soft drinks, butter, bananas, beans, rice and other items.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Marcelina de 49 años es casada con 05 hijos aún dependientes, ella pertenece al grupo  “Unidos Para Triunfar” conformada por 06 mujeres empeñosas y solidarias.  Marcelina comenzó con la venta de golosinas donde lo realizaba ambulatoriamente, con lo que pudo ahorrar y el apoya de su pareja, pudo aperturar su propio negocio, pues actualmente cuenta con una tienda en su domicilio. Se siente feliz pues pudo cumplir con unos de sus sueños, el de contar con  negocio propio. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para surtir su tienda, la cual comprará abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” están agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Marcelina es la primera del lado derecho  viste chompa fucsia y blusa blanca. Marcelina Guillen no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old, married with 5 children who are still dependent on her. She is a member of the "Unidos Para Triunfar" communal bank made up of six persevering and supportive women. Marcelina started selling candy as a street vendor and with what she could save and the help of her partner, opened her own store. Which is located in her house. She feels happy as she was able to fulfill one of her dreams, that of having her own business. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy a greater variety of goods like groceries, drinks and candy to stock her store. To continue strengthening her business is her goal. The “Unidos Para Triunfar” group is grateful and promises to continue working hard. Marcelina is the first person on the right wearing a fuchsia colored sweater and white blouse. Marcelina Guillen could not be present for the picture as she had to work.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks and candy.

loans.name: Flor De Latencillo Uspantan Group

texts.es:
La señora Roberta de estado civil casada, tiene 33 años de edad, de escolaridad 6to. primaria, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 4 estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura especificamente a la siembra de cardamomo, inició este negocio por la la enseñanza de sus padres y un pequeño terreno que compro su esposo, hasta la fecha lleva 12 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para el mantenimiento de cardamomo, desea en el futuro sembrar mas cardamomo para obtener mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la cosecha de cardamomo. En la fotografia aparecen 16 personas, pero, solo a 13 de ellos se sel soncedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Roberta, 33, is in a common-law marriage and has a 6th grade education.  She has 5 children, 4 of whom attend school.  Roberta works in agriculture cultivating cardamom.  She started this business because her parents taught her how to do this, and her husband bought her a small plot of land.  To this date, she has 12 years of experience.

Roberta is organizing this group, and is requesting a loan to help her maintain her cardamom crops.  In the future, she wants to cultivate more cardamom to obtain better earnings.  The other members of this group also cultivate cardamom.  In the photograph, 16 people appear, but only 13 of these are being granted this loan.

loans.use: to maintain her cardamom crops

loans.name: Jefri

texts.es: Jefri, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Jefri is an enterprising man. He is 29 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children. He is requesting this loan with the desire to buy supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. He wants to care for his coffee crops, with the goal of keeping them in good condition during their growth, in order to harvest a quality product.  The only limitation this man has is the lack of money to continue expanding his business. He is dependent on this business to get ahead. For this reason he has requested this loan. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has no loans with the state banks but FUDECOSUR has given him this loan with better terms and lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria  tiene la edad de 40 años, es casada y vive con el esposo y  dos hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She wants the loan in order to purchase cattle, and when they are big, to sell them and get earnings. The cattle business will help her and her family to get ahead. 

She hopes that with this plan, she will grow and achieve her goals and therefore, in the future, offer her family a better quality of life and more economic stability. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn’t previously had any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Paola Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Paola se encuentra en su segundo ciclo que forma parte del grupo de crédito Damas del Futuro, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque puede compartir gratos momentos con sus amigas y a su vez continuar mejorando su negocio. Viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde 1999, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Paola tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 1 año. Su esposo labora como empleado privado y la casa en donde viven es arrendada.

Doña Paola a mas de pasar en casa al cuidado de su pequeña hija se dedica al comercio, ella vende toda clase de ropa, tiene este negocio desde hace 2 años, su mercadería la vende recorriendo puerta a puerta. 

El crédito es para comprar ropa para tener más variedad de mercadería.

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Paola is in her second loan cycle as part of the communal bank "Damas del Futuro."  She likes these types of loans, because she can share pleasant moments with her friends and also continue to grow her business.  The members of this group live around the city of Cuenca, a city that is known for its beautiful architecture and which has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1999.  Here there are many places to enjoy nature, and the people are kind, gentle, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Paola is 21 years old and is married.  She and her husband have a 1 year-old daughter.  Her husband works as a private employee, and they live in a rented house.

In addition to caring for her small daughter at home, Paola has a business selling all types of clothing.  She's had this business for 2 years, and she sells her merchandise door-to-door.  

Paola will use this loan to buy clothing so that she can have a greater variety of merchandise.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle to use in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, tiene 34 años, es soltera, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ha cultivado granos básicos y café en el terreno de su casa. 
Tiene 7 años de dedicarse al cultivo de los granos básicos como café, maíz y frijoles. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos la cual cubre sus gastos. El préstamo que solicito es el sexto ciclo con ODEF y es por 5,000 lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar fertilizantes y siembra de frijol para aumentar la producción e ingresos. Su objetivo es comprar un terreno para tener más tierra donde cultivar.
texts.en:
Maria, 34, is single and has two children who live with her in the town of Gracias, Lempira. She has always worked in agriculture, cultivating basic grains and coffee on her land.

She has been planting grains like coffee, corn and beans for 7 years. She sells her products in the local market. This activity is her source of income to cover her expenses. She asks for a loan of 5000 lempiras as part of the sixth cycle with ODEF. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and to plant beans that will increase her production and profits. Her goal is to buy a piece of land to have more space to plant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plant beans.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en: Waad is 22 years old. She lives in Mafraq-Jordan with her family at a rented house. She has four sisters. Waad is currently studying computer and information systems in her fourth year at Al-Bait University, which is located near Mafraq. She is planning to continue her studies until she graduates, but she is facing financial difficulties that are not letting her be able to pay for her study fees. As a result, Waad is requesting a loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen was born in 1982. She is married and has three sons. She lives in Zarqa, Jordan. Nisreen has been running her own gym since two years ago. She is planning to buy more machines to increase the number of gym members, raise her future income and expand this project. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy a fat burner machine which her members have been requesting and that might make her gym special.

loans.use: to buy a fat burner machine.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman lives in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region. Arman is married and he lives with his wife, two children (a son and a girl) and his father, who is already retired. Arman’s wife does not work, and she takes care of their children. Their family income hardly covers their minimum needs and there also remain problems for which they have not enough finances to solve. Arman works as a miner at the mining company with a small salary. His work is very dangerous and hard, but he has no other way since to find another job is very hard and needs a long time. 

Arman asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams as he needs to do wiring of electrical wires in the apartment and to buy sockets, switches and a fuse package. He hopes very much that Kiva lenders will support him and gives thanks for it very much.

loans.use: to do wiring of electrical wires in the apartment and to buy sockets, switches and a fuse package.

loans.name: Syprose

texts.en:
Syprose is a married woman with two children who don't go to school. She stays in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition with other retail shops. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Drastamat

texts.en:
Drastamat with his family lives in Kadjaran city, which is in the Syunik region. He is married and has two daughters who are already married and live separately with their families. Drastamat has a higher education; he has graduated from Yerevan State University in the Department of Commodity Research. His wife does not work since she is disabled. 

It is already 16 years that he has run his own business. He has a shop of his own, where he sells food products (sweets, bakery items, juices and alcoholic beverages, cans and some vegetables, eggs, ice cream and even some household products). Drastmat says that his shop is a big one and is very often visited by citizens and nearby villagers, and sometimes it is hard for him to keep it full with a large assortment. He asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a large variety of products for his shop. He will very happy and grateful to get this loan and make the needed purchases.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of products for his shop and thus to keep it full with a large assortment.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a Kenyan woman who is single and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past two years, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and stiff competition.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase 15 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan, age 28, is married and lives in the village of Shilda with her family, husband and two children (6 and 7 years old). Ketevan’s husband is the only one making money in his household working as a welder locally. The family lives in poverty and gets small social assistance from the local government. 

Several times, Ketevan has requested loans from local financial institutions in order to start up her clothing trading business but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected because of lack of experience in the business which is usually demanded by local financial institutions. Her loan request has now been approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credit with soft conditions to country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as "high-risk borrowers" because of low income. With the received credit, Ketevan plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers and then resell these items from her house. Her regular clients will be neighbors and villagers. After investing the funds in her business, Ketevan hopes to generate additional revenue and invest the profits to further develop her business. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FASSOUMBOUGOU, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme ADIARA de en première position de la  droite vers la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI I group are married women who are, on average, 37 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Fassoumbougou, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their sixth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Adiara, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right. 

She plans to use her loan to buy some fertilizers and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Sikasso. 

She is expecting to make an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo es casado, cuenta con 31 años de edad, estudio los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra ejotes, inició este negocio con su señor padre y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para la producción de ejotes, espera en el futuro poder diversificar la siembra para obtener mejores ingresos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de ejote y repollo.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 31 years old and is married. He had six years of primary education and he has five children, three of whom are in school now. He makes his living in agriculture planting green beans. He started the business with his father and now has seven years of experience. 

He organized a group and is requesting a loan that he will use to buy supplies for green bean production. In the future he hopes to be able to diversify his crop to be able to make a better income.

The other members of the group make their living planting green beans and cabbage.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant green beans.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is 57 years old, and he lives with his son in Yerevan. Norik is divorced, and he with his son lives in a small flat. Norik has a higher education as an economist and for many years has been engaged in a trading business, but now he works as a manager at the electronics shop. Norik’s son is 29 years old, and for some time he used to work as a driver but now is unemployed. 

Norik has taken loans from Nor Horizon seven times, and he has paid each back successfully. This time Norik asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian Drams to perform his son’s wedding party and to cover some expenses connected with it. He thanks beforehand Kiva lenders for their support since it is very important for him to be able to perform his son’s wedding party properly and nicely.

loans.use: to perform his son’s wedding party and to cover some expenses connected with it.
